I find the phone to be what I need and love that I have a “home” button.

Heading: iPhone 8 vs iPhone 6s Plus, iPhone SE, & iPhone X.
Text:
I have recent experience using both the iPhone SE and iPhone 6s Plus. The Plus model was too big since I use a case with a belt clip to carry the phone, and the SE's screen was a bit too small. I am going to compare my review of the iPhone 8 (purchased unlocked at full price and used with Verizon prepaid) mostly to the iPhone 6s Plus, but one has to understand that the SE especially at prepaid price is an excellent, outstanding phone too with almost all of the same features as the Plus!) 

Pros:

The iPhone 8 is an upgrade in a few ways. Apple includes a compare feature on its website so I won't go into all of the details, but I will try to address the ones that are upgrades to the iPhone 6s Plus. 

True Tone display does make the screen easier to read because the lighting isn't as harsh. This is coming from someone who has vision problems and prefers the "daylight" bulbs because I need good lighting to see.

This phone features water resistance, which means one can now uses cases that might provide better protection or do not muffle sound. With that said, I use a Ghostek Nautical 2 case also sold through BestBuy. It provides great protection combined with waterproofing. Since I use hearing aids to stream audio, sound being muffled isn't an issue and people can hear me clearly.

The camera specs *seem* to be similar, but I can see a difference! The pictures are clearer, sharper, and more detailed. Also, this smaller model has the optical image stabilization for the video too. To get the best quality video, I shoot in 4K even though the final output will be in 1080p. Larger files won't take up as much room on this model thanks to upgraded compression features. This model includes an improved flash too.

The sound quality on the iPhone 8 seems to be louder and clearer. There is a front speaker too.

With my previous phones I also used battery cases. The iPhone 8 with the same use seems to get me through the whole day, but I plan to buy an external battery charger that will also allow me to charge wirelessly soon.

Neutral:

The bluetooth is supposed to be an upgrade. I am not sure if this is a hardware of software issue with iOS 11 through 11.2.1. At the time of this writing, I am having some issues with it. With phone calls, my made for iPhone hearing aids do not work as well. Sometimes only one connects. Other times I notice a periodic static or crackling sound.

Areas for Improvement:

What I do not like about the IPhone 8 is the glass back because of how it is designed. In my opinion, it is a very poor design choice, and what weighted the most heavily on my decision to knock star off the overall rating. It is almost half of the cost of the phone without insurance to replace this! The iPhone 4s has a glass back too. However, one could remove two screws and slide off the back, which means the back plate and battery were easily replaced.

A fast charging wall adapter was not included in this premium priced phone. I use a Belkin (also sold through BestBuy) or iPad one instead of the one included with great results.

Without a case, the "gold" looks like rose gold around the edges and several shades lighter on the back. It looks expensive and stylish, but this look disappears with a case. I miss my Rose Gold that could be seen even through a clear back case.

Comments:

I didn't wait for the iPhone X. I think the technology behind the facial recognition features is impressive. However, without Touch ID too, I am willing to wait to see how this works out and will decide again when I upgrade next time. I would prefer the bigger iPhone screen on a smaller size. The built-in portrait features are a plus, but I can do most of that with software. These three differences were not worth the price difference to me.

Overall Conclusion:

I am enjoying using my IPhone 8 with improves on previous models, and it was the best overall choice for me.

Heading: Good device for the price
Text:
I bought this as an upgrade from an iPhone 6. There’s no doubt that this is a better phone, in all aspects. It’s fast, wireless charging is a cool feature, and it’s nice to have 64 GB of storage. I do have some regret that I didn’t get the iPhone X, but it really came down to price. The iPhone 8 was on sale, at the time of purchase, and was half the cost of the X.

Pros:
- 64 GB storage is ample (at least for now). Definitely a breath of fresh air after dealing with 16 GB and constant storage management. 
- The phone is fast. The A11 chip seems really responsive. Apps open quickly, on-screen animations/transitions are seamless, and it just feels fluid in your hands. 
- It has a good camera. 12 MP is really all I need for the photos I take. It’s definitely not the best phone camera around, but is a noticeable upgrade from the iPhone 6. 
- Wireless charging. The reason I had to upgrade is because the charging port on my last phone broke. It’s nice that I don’t have to worry about wearing out this phone’s port. Wireless charging is convenient and seems to power up the phone just as quick as plugging it in. 

Cons:
- This phone feels outdated (because it is). I really don’t care too much about having the latest features and an all-screen front. But, if it wasn’t for the upgraded home button and the revised Space Gray color, I wouldn’t know if I was holding an iPhone 8 or 6. 
- The lack of a headphone jack is disappointing. Yes, I can get an adapter or Bluetooth and I will probably get used to it, in time. But, it’s kind of a pain, at the moment. 

Overall, I like this phone. It definitely lacks the modern features and ‘feel’ that other current phones have, but it is a good performer. If you are a fan of Apple phones, need to upgrade, and are looking to save some cash, I would recommend it.

Heading: Takes getting used to
Text: Now that I've had my phone for 3 weeks, I'm beginning to like it a lot more. My last 2 iPhones were the 5S and SE, which were smaller and sturdier. I chose the 8 because of the price and because it fits into my bicycle phone case mount. With that being said, I'm not sure I want to take my phone on bike rides (not a good idea--what if something happens), since it's made of glass. The home button works differently than the other two phones, but thankfully I got Siri every time I punched the home button too hard, and she could help me out. Once you've paid for the protective coating for the screen and found a reasonable case that seems sturdy enough to protect the rest of this slimline phone, hope that's all you have to pay for. Also, I drive an older car with a bluetooth not recognized by the iPhone, so I had to buy a different auxiliary adapter, since the lightening port is different. This just means I can't recharge my phone and listen to music at the same time.

Heading: Helpful?
Text:
I have to wonder what may be the point of writing a review on a phone. The tribal mentality that is Android vs. iPhone has obfuscated any real discussion around fitting the right tool to function. 

Subjectively, and objectively as one can muster, it is redundant to say this is a beautiful functional top shelf device. The only thing I can offer to anyone on the fence is consider whether you are someone that "needs" your device... needs your phone to meld into the million parts of the daily kaleidoscope of your life, to find it's place in your own personal flurry.... or if you are someone that is buying the phone primarily as a daily fidget spinner of sorts; a electronic time killer to insulate the space between the minutes. To keep the walls warm between seasons.

Neither of those are ill things, nor does one always find themselves only in summer flurries or wedded to the cruel mistress of hurry up and wait. 

Do you need your device, or does your device need you?

The iPhone 8 is a stalwart servant to your court.

Android is a small child, a forever needy fledgling.

The rest is what you're made of.

My iPhone 7 Plus is still going strong, where a Android phone would start bugging out at about a year. Bravo!

Heading: It's an iPhone
Text: I just upgraded to this iPhone 8 from my iPhone 6 (which was literally splitting at the seams). So far it's..... well and iPhone. I don't know about all the plusses yet, but the negatives are: costly (of course), the ridiculous haptic response of the home button (feels like the phone is breaking - why can't we turn off the response), and the obvious lack of a headphone jack (which I knew ahead of time). I guess the level of customization has improved, but I'm not sure about the faster speed or better camera (I use this mostly for calls, texts, and simple game apps (not as a mini computer). If I wasn't locked into Apple products, or if the older model iPhones were still so expensive, I would have stayed with the 6.

Heading: Really OK
Text:
It’s an iPhone. It’s not much different than my last iPhone except it runs the latest iOS without having to worry about Apple’s intentional slow-down yet. 
I like the Plus- my last phone was standard size and I really love the larger screen. But it’s heavy. 
Sometimes the phone stops responding to touch screen for no apparent reason. This is concerning. And I may bring it up with Apple Support after a little google research. 
Overall - it’s really OK. It’s a good phone but probably not much better than any other good smart phone.

Heading: Upgraded from 6 to 8
Text: Decided not to wait for battery replacement on my iPhone 6 and just upgrade to the 8. It's basically the same phone with a better camera and force touch, plus all the other new bells and whistles. I debated on getting the X but wasn't that impressed with face id and I'd have missed the home button too much. My first iPhone was the 4 and lasted me until the 6 came out and now I got the 8, which is better longevity than any of the android phones we've had. Battery lasts super long now which is great, camera is nice, the gold is pretty. New (to me) home button takes some getting used to, specifically that touch id so so super fast now that it takes me to my home screen when I really just wanted to quick check my notifications on my lock screen or swipe to take a photo. I need to get used to just picking it up and tilting it instead.

Heading: A nice upgrade
Text: I am very pleased with my i-phone 8. It is an upgrade from my i-phone 5c and so there were lots of changes. I like the bigger size, and find it easier to use when typing. However, it is not too big and fits nicely in my purse. I am still learning all its features. I do which it came with a booklet on the features and how to use them. The camera takes has several new ways of using it and takes very good photos.

Heading: Great iPhone for everyone
Text: Bought this phone for my wife and it was so great I had to get one for myself. Large, clear screen, water resistant and great battery life. A nice upgrade from the iPhone 6s. I didn’t think the wireless charging would be that much of a bonus but I really enjoy not having to plug it In anymore. Oh and the camera takes really good pictures too!

Heading: Not as good as the 7
Text: This phone is slower, screen flickers, much heavier. I should have stayed with the 7.

Heading: Great practical phone
Text: This phone is perfect for everything I need it for. The battery lasts all day, the camera takes quality pictures, and everything runs smoothly. And was all at a great monthly price point.

Heading: Overrated
Text: Yet another overrated and extremely over priced product by Apple. Maybe one day they’ll actually make a product without any glitches and they’re only “help” is download the update.

Heading: Perfect.
Text: My wife has been rocking a flip-phone since 2014. Recent events required that we upgrade our phones. She selected the iPhone 8 because she's an Apple lover. Yes, we know there's an iPhone X. Big deal. We don't conduct our lives over cell phones, unlike many of you. First and foremost, it integrated seamlessly with her other Apple toys -- her Mac, her iPod and her iPad, which was a plus, without her having to do anything at all. Also, the features and amenities are first-class and the camera is very near DSLR quailty. But we use it for making and receiving calls, mostly. After all, it's a PHONE. And a very good one.

Heading: Upgraded from a failing iPhone 6s.

The camera works great for a non technical person such as myself.  The phone features are similar to the 6 yet seems to be enhanced for a slightly better quality, such as in the camera.

Heading: New upgrade
Text: Got this phone because I was upgrading from an iPhone 5. I still liked it with its button feature and new camera features. So far so good.

Heading: Excellent phone
Text: I took a break from iphone for a while and moved to Android, Samsung Galaxy S7. I liked the Galaxy. The main disappointment with the S7 was batter life. It does a have a bigger battery than the iphone 8 but you would never know it. I missed the iphone and decided to come back. No regrets at all! In fact I believe this is the best phone I've ever owned. Battery life, ease of use, quality hardware and software --- all of it is just exceptional. Apple knew what they were doing on this one. I am happy to be back with iphone and don't intend to leave again. I do like many things about Android but I found myself customizing android to be like Apple. To anyone thinking about upgrading from another iphone or changing from android -- this is the phone to do it with!

Heading: Great Phone
Text: Easy to use and a good size. Camera on phone takes fast and great quality photos too!

Heading: Great Phone.
Text: I bought this phone to upgrade my family member's 5C. Obviously there was a huge immediate difference. I was pleased to know that Bestbuy had this phone new and in stock. My family member is very pleased with the updated camera features as well as the memory size increase. Seamless transfer of the old data from the previous phone. Thanks to Bestbuy for taking care of the transfer!

Heading: Great new phone
Text: My old iPHONE 6s was having serious battery issues and was becoming unreliable. I was looking for a reasonably priced upgrade without dropping a grand on a new X. This is a solid reliable phone with a great camera and 64GB has enough storage for my music and photos. Upgrade from the old phone to the new phone was an easy task. I chose the all black finish and am very satisfied with my purchase. I've upgraded phones for my family multiple times with Best Buy and have always had excellent service and helpful advice in restructuring the data plans.

Heading: Nice upgrade
Text: I am not one to run out a grab the newest phone and I actually planned to keep using my Iphone 6 until it died but my son's phone was not working so I finally gave in and used my upgrade so he could have my old phone. It's definitely nice to have a new phone again that has a decent battery life and the camera does seem to be quite a bit nicer on the Iphone 8. The touch screen seems to be quite a bit more sensitive, which I'm not crazy about but that might be something I can adjust once I play with the phone a bit more. No complaints yet.

Heading: Very good Phone.
Text: Nice upgrade for me. Old phone was an Apple so the transition to the new one was easy as operating the phone is basically the same. Still getting use to some of the new features but not an issue. The larger screen is great and still compact enough for keeping in pockets. I'm really enjoying the battery life. I don't think my old phone was this good when it was new. The Best Buy associate was really knowledgable and helpful when I was determining what I would purchase and made all the corrections I needed with my service provider. The service I received was a big plus in addition to the features I like about the phone itself.

Heading: Nice phone fair price.
Text: When my IPhone 6 got to the point it wouldn’t hold a charge it was time to get a new one, since I didn’t want to spend a small fortune on a IPhone 10 this phone was a good economical choice. The #8 does everything I need a phone to do and it didn’t “break the bank”. Service at my local Best Buy was excellent and the associate I dealt with was very helpful. I highly recommend Best Buy for all electronic purchases.

Heading: Sometimes Simple Is Better
Text: My wife loves the simplicity of the iPhone 8. Size it tough to beat and the performance and battery life is still good. If you don't need all the wiz bang features of the X or XS then the iPhone 8 is still a great phone at a great price.

Heading: Great graphics, intuitive to use
Text: Great phone easy to use similar to previous phone in use

Heading: Good Phone. Held up well on long trek.
Text: Took my new iPhone 8 on a 10 day, 100 mile hike to Mount Rainier in Washington state. It worked well overall. Photos came out fantastic. It held up well under rough trail conditions even after I dropped it. Glad I had a screen protector though. Screen protector cracked, but the glass itself did not. I suspect under normal drop conditions the phone will hold up well. It would have gotten five stars if the battery performed just a tad better when it got cold on the trails. I know the cold saps a battery charge, but being a brand new phone, I thought the battery should have lasted just a bit longer than it did. When we were in warmer temps, battery charge lasted many many hours. Overall though, I'm happy with the phone and it performed admirably at high elevations.

Heading: Worst Phones ever! Just Buy Samsung
Text:
We upgraded from the iPhone 7 because the 7 was messing up, so we just decided to go with this phone. It locked up after a few months and went completely unresponsive. Now we are trying to get it repaired and the appointments just to see the phone are until 1/2 week from now and then it can take up to 2 weeks to get it back.
Going with Samsung from now on.

Heading: Love this Phone

It is solidly made, the new features (especially the camera) are incredible, and I can’t say enough positive things about this phone. If you don’t want to spend the significant amounts of money for an iPhone X, the 8 is a really great alternative.

Comes with AC adapter and headphones with lightning adapter, instead of headphone jack, and lightning cable.

So I have to remember that when the switch is close to the screen, volume is on, and when it's away from the screen volume is off (vibrate only). Hope I don't forget when I'm in class!!

Heading: Ordered online and picked up in store

She uses it mostly to play educational apps. Easy to use and set up screen time so she’s unable to delete,install or do in app purchases.

Text: i have had a iphone ever since apple realeased it. i do not like that they no longer put a headphone jack on their phones and also how fast the batteries seem to need to be replaced. i purachased the iphone 8 over the iphone X because it still has a home button. i love my phone.

Heading: Learning curve
Text: I like the new photo options and battery life compared to the iPhone 5 I had, but this one is an inch longer and 1/2" wider in its Otter Box. Some pockets in women's wear won't hold it. The screen also seems to dim faster, and I can't hear a tone for texts even though I fixed the settings for it. I did need the bigger memory, so that will be the biggest plus in the long term. Given the choices, this was better for my old-lady needs than an X model!

Heading: Great phone
Text: Easy to use, light weight and pictures come out great.

Heading: Nice phone.
Text: I waited to review this phone until I had it for a while. So far I like it quite a bit. It’s definitely way nicer than any other iPhone I’ve had. The camera is nice, takes great photos. The only complaint I have is every now and then when typing a text message the key board freezes. You have to close the app down and re-open to get it to work again. Over though it’s definately a nice phone for what I use it for.

Heading: Love the space and camera
Text: I went from a 4 to an 8. Bigger but not too much so. Was happily surprised by the Live Photo. Really cool. Still getting used to the top button being moved to the side. Love the space. I can take as many pictures as I want. Few other things that are kind of quirky that I need to figure out how to fix. Mostly with the Bluetooth. It switches to the phone when asking her to send text but when I try again it works.

Heading: great transition phone
Text: After clinging onto my 6S for years, i decided i needed a phone with stronger glass but didn’t want anything crazy expensive or fancy. This is a great 6S-but-better device. The transition to being headphone jackless hurts a little bit less as I am still familiar with the phone itself (although i do miss getting to use my headphones while charging my phone, but i can get an adapter or pods). The phone feels more luxurious, from the slimmer design and quicker, nicer screen, even with its more frequent vibrate home button click thing (sorry i don’t know the term). Going from 16GB of storage to 256 is a dream, but that is just a personal bonus.

Heading: My Husband Loves This Phone
Text: My husband loves this phone so much that when it was time for an upgrade he chose to keep his phone. That should show you right there what s great phone it is. Easy to use, great photos! He just loves it!

Heading: My new favorite toy
Text: Finally moved on from my 4s, and I’m loving the size and features of this iPhone 8! The size is perfect for me - and photo quality is great for taking cute shots of the grandkids. It was well worth the cost, which wasn’t too bad - after the $100 off from Verizon, and the Best Buy deal for accessories helped a lot. So glad I made the leap, I’ve been looking for a while, and the sales guy at Best Buy sold me, by answering all my questions patiently, and making great suggestions.

Heading: weak battery and screen
Text:
Battery only lasts 4 hours with somewhat heavy usage, 8 hours with normal usage, barely 24 hours with very light usage, mostly with WIFI off. I imagine streaming a 2 hour movie would deplete 90% of a brand new battery. But at least it doesn't shutdown suddenly at 18% like they used to. 
Screen gets scratched alarmingly easily, seriously must be either pocket lint or cash bills scratching it. Scratches are not noticeable when screen is actually on though. For the cost of these things, the screen glass should be much more durable to scratching. 
Software is typical apple software, some cool features, some annoying, some ridiculous, not as intuitive or perfect as fanatics would have you believe, but comfortably secure, though not in a privacy sense, apple is about as bad as google and facebook in wanting to know every detail of your life and make ads a part of your life. 
Would I recommend, meh, if an android user was on the fence about switching, I'd tell them apple certainly isn't perfect and is kind of tyrannical, intrusive, and over-hyped, but more secure from hackers. I'd also mention how apple sabotages old devices, that really irks me and made getting another iphone a really difficult decision, still worry this new iphone might only be at it's best for a couple years. If someone was going from iphone 7 to 8, I'd ask why bother.
Oh, also still upset that they omitted the 3.5mm audio jack, that's an example of what I mean by tyrannical.

Heading: Great phone!
Text: I love my iPhone! Great deal from Best Buy! It lasts a long time and the camera is great! Easy to use!

Heading: First iPhone
Text: I have used android phones since I have had a cellphone. This is my first iPhone. My wife has been trying to get me to come to the dark side for years now! She loves her iPhone. I decided to take the buy an iPhone X get an iPhone 8 free offer. She got the X! She is so happy and I have to say I really like the 8. It is so easy to use and I like the size and the speed and the camera! It has really good reception for making phone calls too!

Heading: iPhone 8 is great
Text: Upgraded from an iPhone 6S to the iPhone8.  I am very happy with the battery life and features.

Heading: Great photo for upgrades
Text: Good photo camera and good phone . I’m happy with this phone.

Heading: Not the newest iPhone but a great phone for the $$
Text: The cameras have great resolution. Like all Apple products, the software and hardware work very well together (efficient), and it interact seamlessly with my Mac Book and iPad. Powerful processor that allows me to easily multitask and switch between tasks quickly. I really don't have anything bad to say about the iPhone 8.

Heading: Just a new iPhone
Text: I came from a 5 so it’s a big step up a lot faster and more features. I don’t think the reception is any better for calls. I set it up with iCloud and was easy. If you have Apple Music make sure you have playlists turned on in the library home screen. That setting didn’t seem to transfer from backup. Verizon was a pain, I had to call 800 automated line to activate. The information was right online but just would not take.

Heading: Nice upgrade from iPhone 6s!
Text: Bought this after owning iPhone 6s and it is excellent! Colors are great and it is fast. Great clarity on phone. Only drawback is no headphone jack. Same size as iPhone 6, 6s, and 7 and same cases can be used on all of them. Good battery strength and charges quickly. Comes with AC adapter and headphones with lightning adapter, instead of headphone jack, and lightning cable.

Heading: As always, amazing!
Text:
I’m definitely an Apple junkie, in other words, all of my technology is Apple. 
Prior to getting my iPhone 8, I had an iPhone 6. I feel the iPhone 6, 7, and 8 are pretty comparable in looks and features. I had already downloaded the new software on my iPhone 6 prior to upgrading, so I basically saw what my new iPhone 8 would be like. 
Despite the models being fairly similar, I’m definitely still happy with my upgrade. Obviously the phone itself is faster and doesn’t experience as many glitches as older models. 
I have experience a few issues with software updating, to the point where it’s had go into recovery mode. I have my phone backed up, so it’s not a huge downfall, just annoying. 
I definitely feel the Touch ID settings are much more accurate and easier to use opposed to older models. 
I have the gold model and I have to say I love the color! The back is also a glass material as opposed to the old metal casing. 
This material definitely feels more durable. I have a cheap and compact case on my phone, and it has still survived my toddler throwing it on our wood floor! 
If screen size is what you’re looking for, I would definitely go with a plus or X model. For me, I like that the regular model is small enough to hold in one hand, but still has a decent screen size. 
For it being the brand new model, I definitely love my 8 despite the software glitches and updates!

Heading: Iphone 8, greatness
Text: My Iphone 7 died on me, so went ahead and upgraded to the Iphone 8, love how fast it is, and the camera seems to take a lot better pictures. Didn't care for the IPhone X, wanted to keep my home button feature. So I would say this is my favorite Iphone yet, go and get yourself one or upgrade if you haven't already.

Heading: always a great cell phone
Text: I have had the the iPhone 8 for about 50 days, and I love it because Apple added some new features on this model. The screen is more bright, and the built-in camera is much improved than iPhone 6.

Heading: Very nice phone!
Text: Excellent phone, very easy to use.  Very smart with an excellent camera to boot!

Heading: Great camera for a beginner
Text: I love my new Apple Iphone 8. The camera on the new phone is amazing. the clarity of the pics look like they were taken on a proffesional camera. Above all the experience itself was fantastic. Kaylee was my sales representative and could not have been better.

Heading: Great phone
Text: I've always been a fan of Apple products, and the new Iphone 8 is no exception. It has a great camera. The battery life is fantastic (unless you are FaceTiming which drains the battery faster). I thought I wouldn't like the no headphone jack gimmick, but nowadays most headphones are wireless anyways or you can use the headphone jack adapter, which really isn't as burdensome as I thought.

Heading: Nice Upgrade from 5c
Text: My old 5c was still working but short on memory. Got the iPhone 8 and it faster and has great features. Saving $100 at Bestbuy made the purchase easier. Transferring from the old to new iPhone went easy at Bestbuy.

Heading: Traded a Samsung Note 8 to Get Back to iPhone
Text: Late last year, I decided to follow the hype and go with the Samsung Note 8. It is a beautiful phone. However, the OS is not as seamless as an iPhone. I found myself missing group message from my iPhone using family; what a pain to actually have to dial into voicemail; trying to listen to MY OWN MUSIC was quite an adventure. Not as smooth as iTunes. So after a year, I decided to switch back to the iPhone and I couldn't be happier. The iPhone 8 is blazing fast, the apps are spectacular and battery life is really good. I am truly happy that I switch back.

Heading: Great iPhone!
Text: Love this iPhone, clear crisp pictures Gilda battery life well too.

Text: This is a great iphone. Great upgrade. Love the features. I would have purchased the iphone X but i did not want that big of a phone. The 8 series had a normal size phone. The 256 gig storage is amazing. The camera on this phone is stunning. Totally worth the upgrade.

Heading: Solid phone except home button
Text: This is a super solid phone that still holds up with the new iOS. My biggest gripe is that the home button does not recognize my finger print half of the time only after a year of usage. It’s pretty annoying but doesn’t stop me from accomplishing most of goals with the device. If you are debating getting this phone or the XR, I’d probably spend the extra bucks for the XR. It’ll stay in the iOS upgrade game that much longer and no more home button.

Heading: Perfect for an older iPhone user

Heading: Hey, It's an iPhone
Text:
This was an upgrade from an iPhone 6 for me as my old phone was suffering from bad battery life and not enough memory. The 256GB of memory will more than solve my memory issues, and the battery life is great for now. Hopefully Apple will take its time on creating battery crushing firmware updates for this one.

At the end of the day its still just an iPhone. Same excellent call quality (yes! some of us still "talk" on a phone) and the same iOS interface we have all come to either love or hate.


If you have an iPhone, it is a nice upgrade. If you have a Droid an like that OS and can live with the iffy call quality, you should stick with a Droid.


Nothing here that is life (or platfrom) changing in my mind

Heading: from 6 to 8
Text: so I was part of the group of folks whose phone was doing the dying dance. My 6 would get to 52% and then shut down. I would turn it back on and then it would only have 10% or less. Finally, I was over it. I marched (well drove) over to my local Best Buy to purchase a new phone. The 8 is a beautiful phone with more storage, smoother transitions in apps, and great battery life. Im not all the way into the whole screen button thing. but my biggest frustration is the requirement for wireless earphones in order to charge. I mean, out of the box you can not listen to the ear buds and charge. I'm sure there are adapters to allow you to do it, but it's taking some adjusting. I won't die. (First world problems). Overall it's a good phone.

Wireless charging is the best function I have found so far. I am a neat and organized person, I am that person that has a spot for his keys, wallet, wedding ring, and phone. Heading: A Nice Upgrade from iPhone 6
Text: Camera is much better quality, the security steps are much improved, and the feel of the phone seems weightier/sturdier. Other than this - it's not too much different from the 6 or 7 - except for the obvious upgrades in capability and memory. So far no problems or quirks. Everything's working great.

Heading: It's an iPhone!
Text: So it's an iPhone, what more needs to be said? I've used iPhones for many years. In the middle or last year I made the swithch to google phones; the pixel 2 then the 3. Decent phones, no doubt and a pure android experience. However, I missed the perfection that iPhone offers in it's OS. I am not one who cares all that much about customization; if something works well then let it work. I will say this about the iPhone 8 -- I am so very impressed with the battery. In my opinion and experience it lasts longer than the pixels. Pixel batteries are larger, to be sure. But they have to do more. iPhone batter and system just work well together and are far more efficient. Just to give you an example; I took my phone off the charger yesterday at 9:30 am. It is now 11:30 am (the next day) and I have 25% batter left on it, with a good deal of usage, the same as I would have used on a pixel phone. My previous pixel phone would have been dead long ago. The iPhone is still going. This is impressive.

Text: This is the first APPLE product i’ve ever owned. I switched from having android over to APPLE just to try it out, and I like it. Usually would own Samsung phones, but like them both equally. One feature I really like is being able to turn on/ off the data for each individual app with the iphone8.

Heading: The Right Phone for Me
Text:
When I finally resolved to upgrade from my iPhone 5S, the decision came down to the 8, 8+, or X. I went with the 8 because I preferred the more compact size, and didn't feel like the extra $300 justified the facial recognition, better camera, etc. that the iPhone X offers. I went with 64G because I don't store a lot of content (music, videos, etc.) on my phone; I keep most of my content library in iCloud and download as needed.

So far, I'm really liking this phone, but there has been one issue: poor cellular reception in my house, which has also been a problem for my wife with her iPhone 6. This was never an issue with my 5S but there have been multiple occasions with the iPhone 8 where people have had difficulty hearing me (although I could hear them fine). It could be a Verizon issue or it could be a phone issue, I'm not sure. Will try to post an update once I have more info.

Heading: My teenage daughter loves the phone
Text: She is over the top excited about the photo and video  quality. The videos from the fireworks last weekend came out breathe taking.

Heading: Great upgrade from my 6s!

After looking over the two phones, I decided to stay with Apple. I got it in red and I absolutely love the color! I was worried that the new phone would be too big, but it's still a good size and I feel comfortable holding it and using it. I get to keep all my apps and I like the camera too!

The home button being part of the screen (and no longer physically clicking down when you push on it) is not an issue for people who prefer it - there's a setting to set that gives a tactile response as if you clicked on it. I've always used cute/cheap cases from eBay/Amazon, but since this phone has a GLASS back, a more dependable case is required. Also, I don't love the removal of the headphone jack. I need to buy more accessories to let me continue to use my FM transmitter in my car and a splitter to be able to charge and listen to music at the same time.

Heading: Typical iPhone - Just Works!
Text: I have had 3 iPhones and love the way they just work. I know many of the Android phones compete and maybe even have more features. I have thought about switching at times. The thing that keeps me coming back is incremental improvements to a great phone that works. The breadth of the app store is incomparable. The iPhone 8 isn't much different from the previous generation, but it does seem to be a lot faster. It has good battery life. I miss the headphone jack but am finding ways to work around the change.

Heading: Just an average user
Text:
I am not a avid phone junkie. There are some that utilize their phones for just about everything . No judgment here just the way our society is today and to be honest I am not so much or perhaps just not as quick. I see lots of advantages from a iPhone 6 to the 8. The camera is a plus, The operating system is much more responsive and the cell reception in the north area of my city is much better as I have both of the MAIN cell services with multiple device that apple provides and do not think it has to do the service provider. All in all a great phone but a bit pricey as it comes from an old rather dapper chap ( if may add) like myself that finds himself more routinely saying, " I remember when .... and in this case - " I rember when I could get a cell phone for free....
hahahahah!

Suddenly texting used all of our data, so the learning curve is about much more than opening and closing apps. We have made some changes to settings, but this is not what I expected. Otherwise, the phone is great.

Heading: Beat my expectations!!
Text:
I have to admit, I was hesitant to buy this phone at first. I was coming from an iPhone 6s 64gb, and I didn't see too much in the way of upgrade features. 

Well suffice it to say, I've been pleasantly surprised. For starters, it's nice to return back to the glass enclosure that earlier iterations of the iPhone had. It just feels like it gives the phone a more premium look. Also, it could just be me, but the colors on the iPhone 8 blow away those from my 6s. It just seems like the colors pop a lot more on this new phone. Best yet, as childish as this may sound, the Space Gray color on this phone is true to form. The Space Gray on my 6s was more silver looking to me. Overall, very happy with this new phone and I highly recommend it!!

If you're willing to spend money on wireless headphones then charging the phone and listening to music should not be a problem.  Overall I recommend the phone.

Heading: Solid Phone
Text: I bought the iPhone 8 almost immediately after it went on sale. I needed an upgrade from my iPhone 6, but really wasn't interested in dropping a grand on the iPhone X. The 8 has beautiful screen definition and a great camera. It runs quickly and I very rarely have any issues with my programs/applications closing or malfunctioning. I use my phone A LOT and most of the time my battery lasts all day without an additional charge. The phone itself is very light weight and the color is super pretty - I would call it more of a rose gold than a gold. I also feel like it's very durable, especially for being all glass. I do have a case and screen protector on it, but I swear I've dropped it a hundred times and don't have any scratches or breaks.

Heading: A great phone.
Text:
Probably not worth it if you're upgrading from an iPhone 7, but if you're doing the Verizon payment plan, why not, right?

Upgrades are:

- Faster processor
- Wireless charging (this method charges very slowly; only beneficial overnight)
- (I think) faster cable charging. I can usually get 80% battery life in about an hour.
- Slightly better camera

That's really it. I upgraded from that iPhone SE, and that seemed very fast (it ran the same processor as a 6S). I mean honestly, at a certain point faster processors won't matter.

The glass back is very pretty, but the outer rim is still aluminum so it is very prone to dents. 

Everyone is waiting for the iPhone X anyway... haha.

Heading: Solid Update & Great Performing Camera
Text: Having owned my old iPhone 7 Plus for 3 years but still running great, I hadn’t thought much about buying another phone until the 11 Pro was announced. I liked what Apple offered on it and made the investment. I wasn’t disappointed and even surprised in other features like the fact it can use AT&Ts 5GE network which isn’t real 5G but LTE using multiple antennas to double up the bandwidth. Cool! As for the camera and battery, the reason I bought it, didn’t disappoint me. Taking pics is now a lot more powerful and faster yet keeps it simple and battery life helps enjoy it for longer as it’s the best I’ve ever had on any smartphone. I’ve been averaging about 15 hours of heavy usage in the last couple of days. Everything from enjoying music and videos, texting, phones calls, IG & Snapchat. Even did some video editing after capturing some video and taking pictures. I’m sure I can improve the life once the novelty of it goes away and I don’t turn it on unnecessarily. LoL As always its way faster and the screen looks amazing in any light. Though a little heavier than any phone I’ve used, the Midnight Green looks awesome in my opinion. As to why I like using an iPhone, I know there are lots of choices running Android but the simplicity of taking pics and video, editing them and syncing them across my devices and posting them while on the move are key for me. So, that’s my take on the iPhone 11 Pro Max after the last 4 days.

Heading: Pretty impressive!
Text: I waited to upgrade my 8 plus even though i could have done so when the 11 was out. Watched alot of reviews  and finally upgraded about 2 weeks ago and oh boy iam impressed with the improvement on the camera department!although its not like day and night different! I could care less about other features tbh, to me the best camera is the one that you always have in your pocket. Thats why i upgraded and it was because i was due to upgrade. If i wasnt id rather wait untill my 8 plus paid off and skip this gen of iphone and wait for the 12 or something. The camera is worth the upgrade from my 8 plus but still i dont think it deserves the ridiculous 1250 dollar price tag. If you have the 8 plus or the x series and they are not paid off yet, trust me you can wait but if you want to be that guy/girl who always wants to have the latest and the greatest from apple and have tons of money to burn, well no one can stop you doesnt matter how many honest reviews you have read or watch.

Heading: Amazing Camera & Battery
Text:
So, at this point if you are not familiar with iOS and what iPhones are all about here comes a short summary. Apple iPhones are normally great hardware, build quality, and easy UI. Unlike Android, normally you don’t hear spec sheets on iPhone. RAM, battery size, processors are usually a mute point because they iPhone run iOS which can’t really compared to Android. Don’t get me wrong I’ve used many, many Android phones (most recently the Samsung Note 10+) and they have some amazing phones, with equally amazing cameras, and features. 

So, what sets this iPhone apart from the ones that have come before, even the XS, is the cameras are a huge step forward, and they battery is hard to kill. Most phones take great photos in optimal lighting conditions. What sets phones apart is how they handle low light, or night photography. Here is where this iPhone really shines. The images that this device is able to capture with little light is amazing. With Deep Fusion around the corner, you will also see an increase in detail in most photos that don’t use the Night shot mode or HDR. The battery holds up amazingly well. Even after a day of heavy usage, screen on over 8 hours I am able to end the day around 20-30% easily. I usually unplug around 6am and plug it back in around 10-11pm. Never do I feel like I need to top off the battery for fear of not making it through the day.

Everything else on the phone is still great, but not what I would consider a huge step up from previous models. Screen looks amazing, super bright in direct sunlight, Speakers are great, sometimes I forgo my Bluetooth speaker and just use the phones speakers. The matte glass back feels great, but most people won’t see it since most cover it up with a case to protect this investment. 

I would definitely recommend this to anyone, especially those already locked in to the Apple ecosystem. Apple’s iOS 13 is great, and offers some great features, but that isn’t specific to this phone so go and upgrade your old device first to see what you are getting here. I am very happy with my upgrade.

Heading: Cost to value ratio is closing
Text: I really like this iphone and iOS in general. However, what is up with iphone charging $1100 for 64gb vs Samsung Note 10+ offering 256gb in addition to an SD card option for the same price? Things like this are making me take pause about my decision to stay in the Apple ecosystem. I've had this phone a week and I still can't confirm in my mind if this makes sense, to keep my iphone simply because I want everything to work between my apple watch and my ipad. To make me question things even harder, i can get the Note 10+ with 256gb for $150 less than this iphone. Are the camera's that great that it's worth this price bump? These are the things that keep me up at night until my return period expires then I'm in for the next year at least. Never the less, this phone is pretty great so I'm rating it accordingly. No idea if I'm going to keep it or not yet, though.

Heading: THE BATTERY! OH MY! THE CAMERA!
Text: Okay, I'm hearing impaired. I heavily rely on video communication versus voice communication. So I easily drain my battery on my iPhone. But after upgrading to this, you have no idea how thrilled I am to have an iPhone that lasts me from the time I wake up until the time I go to sleep. The battery hasn't gotten low when going to bed. It's so great! When upgrading from iPhone X to iPhone XS Max, I was horrified by the front camera's beautify feature. I take a lot of selfies on X until XS Max, I never took selfie ever again. It was awful not seeing my face naturally because it looks like I'm wearing makeup or own a Samsung phone. However, upgrading to iPhone 11 Pro Max... I was so happy to see that the selfie camera is back to natural like photos. No, beautify garbage.

Heading: Great phone!
Text: This is my phone, and it offers significant advantages over our old 6s’s. First, facial recognition has been flawless not only for the phone, but for apps that accept it. It also is much easier to unlock and use (just look at the face of the phone) than finger print recognition. We also like the fact that we can get a charging pad for it, rather than having to plug and unplug a charging wire. The Apple wires are too short, and the longer 3rd-party ones do not hold up, in my experience, with constant use. The wide, normal, and telephoto lenses are a big improvement. The camera also is far more complex and versatile than the one I had on my 6s. I recommend going online for instructional info. The only thing I am still getting accustomed to is not taking screen-shots (pressing volume up button and on/off button simultaneously). I like the space gray.

Heading: Amazing!!!!!
Text:
So I was content with my iPhone X for years and didn’t see much reason for an upgrade. After seeing what the iPhone 11 Pro Max had to offer I made not only a leap into a newer phone but also my first oversized phone. I love it!
the sound when watching Movies is very immersive completely blew me away for a smartphone!
I have yet to get into all the extra’s but what I have done in the new camera app running the new Tri Cam set up has been nothing short of amazing! Brilliant colors excellent clarity even the less talked about focused audio recording works great when filming your kids riding off on bikes just a little zoom and the sound and image is as if they never left your side. 
Battery life is impressive I forgot to charge over night and managed to make it through the next day of work. 
I have had nothing but fun enjoying my new iPhone Pro Max if you are considering making the switch I say go for it!!!


Ps my only complaint @apple I miss 3D Touch but I have got along without it as well it’s just so hard to say goodbye to yes......3D touch.

Heading: Stellar phone
Text:
It really is a great phone! Best one yet.
Extremely durable, battery life is AMAZING, and 
Here are some things that I’ve noticed that aren’t necessarily bad, but might bother others:
- while the triple lenses are nice, picture quality still sucks. I will say that wide angle lens is awesome tho.
- night mode in the camera settings cannot stay permanently off. It’s great for light absorption in dark situations (similar to a long shutter speed on a dslr), but waiting 1-3 seconds for the picture to process is quite annoying. Especially when you either wanted a dark picture, or have subjects that can’t sit still. You can tap the night mode icon and slide the timer to off, but this must be done every time it detects inadequate light. 
- it’s heavy! Maybe because I came from the 8 & X, but still, for a phone, it’s quite the dense rock lol.
- the screen is “tall”; the Max models are larger In general, but compared to previous Plus models that had top & bottom caption-style hardware/home buttons, this one is pretty long compared to its lack of wideness. If you one-hand operate a lot, I’d recommend playing in many different apps to get a feel for how far you’ll have to stretch lol.
- the flashlight gives a pinkish hue.. unimportant I’m sure, but it’s also not as bright. 
Overall a great device and I would absolutely purchase again!

Heading: This is a great phone!
Text: I’ve been waiting to see whether I wanted to purchase the 11 pro max or wait for the new 12 to come out. I got the 11 pro max and I don’t regret it. It’s better than the iPhone X that I had because I missed the big screen and the ease of a bigger phone in my hands. I love the midnight green color as well. It’s much more different than the basic colors that have been available in the past. The cameras are ASTOUNDING!!!!!!! This gives me a new reason to take more pictures of myself and my wife when we are out and about.

Heading: Apple Is For Winners
Text: “If you’re not first, you’re last” I wanted the best, I wanted to be a winner, so I bought an Apple iPhone. Siri has helped take me to where I am right now. I’m not going to tell you my exact location because then you’ll prolly wanna come and take selfies with MY amazingly awesome iPhone 11pro. Because it takes great selfies and while I consider myself rather dashing at times (I clean up well) I never really considered myself THAT photogenic. That is until this new iPhone. I almost wanna jump out there and call myself an instagram model? Dare to dream? Yes! I know. This phone is THAT awesome!

Heading: Just a flawless product again
Text: I got this phone to replace a flawless 2 year old iPhone X, mainly for the larger screen. You can never go wrong with an iPhone. It’s just a very well executed device that will always work. It might not have all the latest features, but at least the features and processes are perfected. I’m really happy with this phone and the screen size is just right; it’s much easier to type on. The speakers are loud, the battery and cameras are amazing, and most importantly it just works.

Heading: Superb!
Text: Just Upgraded to this from my iPhone 8 Plus 256gb. I see no difference from the XSmax, but the camera is awesome! I can take great selfies with portrait mode and the wide angle is awesome as well. The main reason I upgraded, really. My only issues is that I have to bring the control center down to see the battery percentage and the part that contains the face camera takes up a small portion of the screen. Nothing major.

Text:

I got the Pro, while a family member also purchased the regular iPhone.  Both great phones, and really the biggest noticeable difference is the camera, which comes in handy for my job. With all the lighting effects, the iPhone 11 to good photos, but the Pro, lets just say that I was asked to send all my photos to my family member!

Text: My iPhone X was getting a little slow and glitchy. The 11 Pro is an amazing phone. I love the new frosted look and the new camera system is unbeatable. If you have the XS I would probably wait for the 2020 iPhone, but other than that I'd recommend the upgrade.

Heading: Greatest iPhone Yet!
Text: Most reviews I’ve read about the iPhone 11 Pro seem to lean towards it being nearly the same as the iPhone X. While the front may look the same, I’m here to tell you the internal components are where Apple invested their money on this newest version. The new A13 chip is incredibly snappy, the camera’s picture quality in low light settings is the best it’s ever been, and the battery life is outstanding. Yes, this wasn’t a dramatic visual overhaul of the iPhone, but Apple made significant improvements to the internal components and I am an extremely satisfied customer.

Heading: Switched from Android (Samsung) to Apple
Text: Wife wanted to make the move to Apple and so far loves the new phone.  Obviously had to adjust to some of the new things relating to Apple but have enjoyed the phone and no regrets yet.  I still have my Samsung and not sure if I will convert so will someday need to make that choice when I get a new phone.

Heading: Great overall phone, camera is excellent
Text: If upgrading from an iPhone 8 or earlier, the performance and enhanced camera and other capabilities are worth the price. From a later phone, your mileage may vary. The camera would be the main difference there. Phone feels good in the hand and seems like it is not a slippery. Slightly thicker but seems solid, Picture is very clear and phone speakers pack more volume. No complaints.

Heading: Nice, but beware of learning curve
Text: The display is a lot better than my old 6S Plus. However I cannot find a case I like in the color I like unless I bought the 11.  It is pretty much the same size and feel as the 6S Plus, so no changes in fitting my inside coat pocket. The only big problem I had was that the tech at my local Best Buy inserted my old sim card instead of the new one. This led to a few hours on the phone with AT&T to figure out why I had no service the next day.

Heading: Great upgrade over my old phone
Text: Functionality is pretty much the same as my old iPhone but pictures and security are a nice upgrade

Heading: Best smart phone ever!!
Text: The iPhone 11 pro max is a great smart phone. It’s a little thicker than the last phone but I prefer it better and that means a bigger battery and longer battery life which is absolutely amazing. Everything works so seamlessly smooth and fast that includes Face ID swiping and app response time.  You will not be disappointed and I upgraded from the iPhone XS Max

Heading: The iPhone 11 Pro Max is worth the upgrade!
Text: You’ve read about the phone, the screen, the processor and the camera... It’s all true... the iPhone 11 is well worth the upgrade!  In addition, the battery has an unbelievable life!!  Still playing with the camera and it’s ability to switch between wide, normal and telephoto lenses.  The only downer, the phone is expensive...

Heading: Great phone
Text: I’ve always had IPhones and this one did not disappoint. It’s very sleek and has a great camera.

Heading: iPhone Phreak
Text:
I initially went in to buy the 64 GB; but realized the store Rep sold me a 256 GB.. I look like we was up working for 72 hours straight, no breaks..

I love my new phone though .. I also bought a watch to match; whoop

Heading: A fantastic piece of technology
Text: A definite step forward in the evolution of the iPhone that checks all the right boxes, from build quality to battery capacity and management to camera refinement and image quality. In conclusion, even if high in price, it is the best iteration of the current iPhone design.

Heading: This is better than the  iphone 10 x
Text: If you liked the  iphone 6 plus this is the same size as this WITH no loss of screen with borders and a button like back then  great looking phone !!

Heading: 10/10 apple does it again
Text: Wonderful upgrade from my previous 8 plus. I am a photographer so I wanted to see exactly how the cameras functioned compared to my DSLRs. Not too shabby! I actually just went on a weekend vacation with just my phone and I was pleased with the quality. The battery life is fantastic and I honestly can’t say anything bad about it!

Heading: Huge Upgrade from 8 Plus
Text: I stretched out the life of my iPhone 8 Plus for as much as I could. While this phone doesn't seem to be as big a of leap from the iPhone X, it's a huge difference from the 8 Plus. The three cameras aren't as cumbersome as I thought they would be, and actually serve a great purpose. The phone itself feels great in the hand and looks clean as well.

Heading: Best Iphone Yet
Text: The resolution and pictures from this new iphone are state of the art. It is snappier than the previous generation. If you are on the fence about the bigger size, go for it. I have big fingers and this size really has improved my typing experience.

Heading: Super fast
Text: Great new phone with lightening speed, great clarity, easy to use, fantastic battery life, sharp pictures, large screen, , and video replay like no other phone sold in the past.  Using this phone makes every detail clearer from sound, to picture, to video! Simply the best IPhone put out on the market to date.

Heading: Best phone or camera I’ve ever had
Text:
The reasons this phone is awesome 
1 the screen is crisp with true deep rich colors 
2 the camera is the best for so many reasons  too many to get into this review 
3. The sound is so much better than the 8 plus
4. The battery life is awesome 

If you have an iPhone 8 Plus like I did , this is a major upgrade

Heading: Great Phone
Text: I upgraded to the iphone 11 Pro Max from the iphone 8 plus and I gotta say i'm pretty impressed. I'm not normally the type that has to have the latest and greatest, but once I saw the camera capabilites on this device I just had to have it. So far I am enjoying the device immensly and can't wait to use it for the next couple of years.

Heading: Best Phone
Text: Upgraded from an iPhone X and I’m loving it. I love the bigger screen and I get a better cellular signal on this phone. The battery truly lasts all day with consistent usage. The phone is super fast and the camera is spectacular. This is a huge upgrade over the iPhone X for me.

Heading: iPhone 11 Pro Max 64GB - Gold
Text: Very nice color but wish I got more GB.  iPhone 11 Pro Max doesn’t have the 128GB which I wanted.  If you take a lot of pictures, better get more GB.

Heading: Stove top...nah!
Text: The super wide camera lense is amazing I’ve been able to take great images using it!! I really like the added battery life. My old XS Max lasted just about all day, the 11 Pro Max battery life can still go into the next day and I’ll wake up to it having just a little over 25% battery life ! I’m super happy with this purchase.

Heading: excellent device
Text: Wife loves her new phone and takes awesome pictures and videos. Lots of storage.

Heading: Best I phone I’ve had
Text: So I’m loyal nonetheless to say too Apple but I must say The 11 has the best speaker system it’s ever had, Siri understanding a lot smother. The response time is better across the board. And finally the battery life has lasted me a day and half on a full charge.... YEA I SAID IT

Heading: Excellent Love the screen
Text: I watch a lot of video on my phone, always learning new things. The display is the brightest I’ve seen yet with great detail and colors supporting all the hdr content I want. From YouTube to Plex or really any app benefits from this device greatly compared to other models

Heading: Best in a while
Text: Really the best iPhone in years. The camera(s) especially. The first time In years that a photo opportunity didn’t make me wish I had my DSLR instead. I was honestly a little disappointed with the iphoneX and wasn’t very interested with the follow up XR and XS, which in retrospect makes me very happy I waited. Good job

Heading: Great phone
Text: Upgraded from the Iphone 7plus. Love the Face ID to  unlock the phone. The fingerprint reader was never reliable for me on the 7plus, because my hands are so dry I suppose. Love the new camera lenses and the large display. That being said, I hate that phone are sooo expensive!

Heading: awesome device
Text: Love the phone takes excellent photos and videos. Lots of room to store stuff.

Heading: Not mine, but a great phone!
Text: My son has one (not the one in this review, but the same, just in black).  He feels it was worth the upgrade from the prior years model.  I’d recommend.

Heading: iPhone 11 promax
Text: Went from an iPhone 8 to this! It’s great! Takes awesome pictures and video.

Heading: Best iPhone I’ve owned so far...
Text: Coming from the iPhone XES Max I wasn’t expecting much of a difference, but I absolutely love this phone...The new 3 camera system is amazing and the battery life is a lifesaver...After a few software updates I am good to go with this phone...Thanks Apple for another great product!

Heading: Just an all-around great phone
Text: Well I didn’t like being pushed into getting a new phone because my 6S was just fine with me but once I got to mess around with this thing I begin to like it a little more so I’ll say so far so good price was a little high for a cell phone but we’ll see how well it goes

Heading: Camera is Amazing
Text: Before this phone I had the 8s plus and didn’t plan to upgrade until I saw this bad boy and I am so glad I did. This phone is amazing. My battery last ALL DAY and I use my phone a ton. And the camera is so good! The ultra wide lens is so cool! Def worth the purchase.

Heading: Awesome Phone - Coming from iPhone X
Text:
Battery Life is probably the best part of this phone. Coming from the iPhone X, my battery would be close to dead by 6-7pm. This phone is probably around 60% by then and includes the fast charger. Camera is amazing, and the speed of the phone is great.

Totally worth the upgrade from the X, if you can.

Heading: Loving the new phone
Text: This is an upgrade from the iPhone 8 Plus. I love the difference from the 8th. I’m still trying to get my way around it with the new update and technique. Like adjusting without the home button as for the photos they look more HD than the other phone. Definitely worth the upgrade.

Heading: Great Phone
Text: So far I have had this phone for about 2 weeks and I really like it. I was hesitant to upgrade but the battery lasts longer and the camera is really good.

Heading: Love it!
Text: I am a big Apple fan so this iPhone is everything I expected and then some. I started with the first iPhone and have slowly upgraded to this beautiful phone. I am still learning about all the features but have already noticed the longer battery Life.

Heading: Great phone from apple
Text: I upgraded from an Apple X max. It is true that the camera and this phone is outstanding the picture quality is amazing what doesn’t get said enough is how the sound coming out of the speakers is totally awesome. Also the extra five hours of battery life is a great help as well.

Heading: Love this phone!
Text: The phone is really nice and great quality. Still figuring out the specs but the design is nice and the screen is nice. Not much change in applications if you already have iPhone. The display is great and the phone seems it good quality. Prices are a bit too much

Heading: Best iPhone Ever
Text: The picture quality is the absolute best. I went from a 7 to this and the difference is crazy. Since I am on the go all the time, I use my phone to do lots of work. It is fast and easy. The screen size is always a win. Way to go Apple! And the service at Best Buy was the best!

Heading: iPhone 11 max
Text: Love the camera quality definitely worth buying and the color is dope

Heading: Great phone
Text: I love the picture Quality and the battery life is a lot better. Before I got the iPhone 11 Pro Max I had the iPhone 8 max before are used to keep it on the charger all the time and another thing the speakers are a lot better phone quality is way better all the way around.

Heading: iPhone 11 pro
Text: Nice upgrade from my 6plus but it’s still a little difficult figuring out how to use all of the features.

Heading: Great phone
Text: I was going from an iPhone 6 Plus to this phone so it was a big jump. I love the picture quality of the cameras. The phone feels good in your hand. Feels like quality. Battery lasts all day. Screen is awesome. It’s soo much faster than my old iPhone. I’m glad I made the switch

Heading: Lovely color!
Text: Big jump for me from an iPhone 7 to the iPhone 11 pro max....and no regrets! I love the color (not a bright obnoxious gold) so I can find it easily in my purse. With all the things this phone can do, you’re going to need a lot of storage. :)

I get one every year and even after the 10 max plus the was has a whole new feel.  I gave it a 1 slot minus for the value as it is a pricey little mother.

The camera takes better Portrait pictures than my DSLR!

Heading: I miss the bigger memory

I had the 128 7plus (I know, it was time to upgrade) and never had memory issues. iPhone decided not to do that model no more and I don’t really need the 256, so I listened to the salesman and went down in memory space. Now I have the “memory full” message all the time. Will go and change it tomorrow

Heading: Best iPhone Ever

Heading: Super fun

Heading: I have some issues, but I’m happy I upgraded
Text: Previously, I had a iPhone 7 Plus and wanted to upgrade, but did not need to. It is a good phone, but it freezes on me multiple times of the day. It also does not like doing multiple things at once. Take for instance when I have my phone connect to Apple car play and using WAYS I can only have 25 - 30 minute phone calls. A lot of the time it refuses to maintain a connection after that and I have to call them back after it hangs up. If it stays on for longer then WAYS stops working and turns itself off. This sucks for me because I’m always on the road. It also likes to disconnect from Bluetooth while I’m in the car (While not plugged into anything) during a call and I have to either try to connect it back to my car or restart my phone. Really that’s all I’ve really had to deal with since I purchased the phone. When it works properly it’s a great phone, but that is rare.

Heading: Love my iPhone 11 Pro Max in gold!
Text: Love my iPhone 11 Pro Max in gold!  My younger sister loves hers too (in silver).

Heading: Great screen resolution and battery life.
Text: iPhone 11 pro Max. Great screen resolution and battery life.  Fast processing.  Wireless charging is a convenience.  Camera is slightly better than previous version. Expensive but top of the class.

Heading: People
Text: I had a iPhone 7+ which worked well for three years they didn’t want a trade in so purchased a iPhone max cost me a lot said I had 14 days to try it out, for my use of iPhone my older iPhone was fine so I returned it at a cost of 45$ or close, after I got home I played a couple games until my wife got home I told her that I was just going to use my older phone she said “go get the new one you deserve it” so I went back and asked if they still had my returned phone said it was gone I purchased another and asked if they could give me anything for my old phone I just wanted to get a case protection they said yes 180 something like that took my phone and said only if it turns on I wasn’t worried as I used it 1 hour earlier but all the sudden after they took off my protection case? It did not turn on???? I brought it home and found the left side of phone was open I new it would be very hard to explain so I didn’t don’t like to blame someone for something I can’t prove! So I ate the loss but it was very weird that we at the store used it to get my new one going but 10 minutes later it would not turn on?????????

Heading: I really like this iphone 11 Pro Max
Text: I hold on to my phones for as long as I can.  I detest the cost that Apple prices their products at and I would have kept using my iphone 6s if it didn't start to slow down, have issues with latest updates and just plain cranky.  Shame because it was a great little smart phone.  I like that I could buy the iphone outright at Best Buy and I was up and running within minutes.  Lots of new whistles and bells and I adore the camera and what it offers but especially the long batter life.  I can shoot/save video and hundreds of images at an event and still have nearly 80% battery life at the end of of the day.

Heading: Bad headache.

Exchanged it for an iPhine 11 and never looked back.

Heading: New iphone
Text: I love my iPhone 11 Pro Max!  I had my iPhone 6 Plus for 5 years and the phone had to be plugged in all the time because even after adding two batteries, phone would not hold a charge!  I did not need all the bells and whistles on this camera since I just take pics of my dogs, but the battery life in this phone is great and processor is very fast!  The screen quality is great too! This iPhone 11 is the same size phone as my 6 plus, but with bigger screen since there is no home button, just face recognition!  It is heavier than the 6 plus, but I am getting g used to it!  I hated to give up my iPhone 6 Plus, but I also wanted a 256 GB and my old phone was only 128!

Heading: Works great
Text: This is my wife’s phone, and it offers significant advantages over our old 6s’s. First, facial recognition has been flawless not only for the phone, but for apps that accept it. It also is much easier to unlock and use (just look at the face of the phone) than finger print recognition. We also like the fact that we can get a charging pad for it, rather than having to plug and unplug a charging wire. The Apple wires are too short, and the longer 3rd-party ones do not hold up with constant use. The gold color also is quite striking.

Heading: Love the ease of use and the camera
Text: This phone has a longer battery life, camera is amazing, and the phone is sleek and attractive

Heading: I Love This Phone!
Text: This phone has a large screen with face recognition and is equipped with 256G of storage. That is plenty enough to store lots of apps and photos. The camera is amazing and the photos even look good in low light. The wide angle lens is an added bonus that comes in handy more than I expected. The reverse camera saves at a high resolution to take quality photos. I bought this phone mainly for the camera and I have not been disappointed.

Heading: Best iPhone Ever
Text: I upgraded from an Apple 6S Plus, and while I thought my old phone was good, this one is amazing.  The battery life is outstanding.  I can go 2 days without a charge, and I use my phone constantly.  The camera is amazing as well.  I highly recommend this phone. It's expensive, but worth it!

The best thing is the camera upgrade.  I’m still learning how to use all the camera features but am impressed with the photos I’ve taken so far!

This new iPhone separated itself from the rest, is lighter, it feels right on the hand. The transition from a physical button to a digital operation is painless.
I will recommend this iPhone to anyone with an iphone 8 and below. Newer phones are very similar but I will still say the iphone 11 pro is a better phone.

Heading: Great Phone that scratches easily
Text: I love the phone, especially the camera. After upgrading from a 7 Plus, I got used to the new gestures and lack of home button very quickly. The only negative I have is that, after having several iPhones and never using a screen protector, after less than 2 weeks, my screen has a scratch deep enough for me to feel with my fingernail. I have no idea how it happened because I've treated it the same as all other non-scratched phones. It's bothering me to see so I guess I'll have to put a screen protector on it. Maybe it'll hide the scratch. There is a discussion about it on the Apple page as well. I recommend the phone, just go ahead and put a screen protector on it from the start.

Heading: Awesome phone.
Text:
It’s been seven days with it and can say that it is a great iPhone 
I come from an iPhone XR that i had for barely 4months, it’s crazy!
Prior to that i had an iPhone 6 for 5 years and an iPhone 4s for 4 years, so am not exactly a compulsive iPhone buyer hehe, The only reason that I switch my XR for the 11 Pro was the camera AND because i had the chance to get a good deal on it, but the iOS its great too. i was one of the lucky ones that didn’t get pesky bugs with it. I don’t know how to really describe it all i can tell that so far this is an awesome phone. The pictures it takes look professional, videos and games vey crisp, of course everything else is good too, calls, Bluetooth connectivity with my devices is great no drops, Siri is more intelligent now.so much that am actually using it. Am just a happy iPhone owner the kind of happiness that only iPhone owners know, if you have a chance to upgrade don’t hesitate, you wont regret it.

Heading: Great for people who love taking photos!
Text: I know this is said every year but this is truly the best iPhone camera Apple has ever made! In addition to that, the battery is incredible. I can go a whole day without needing to worry about charging it. If you’re fan of gaming on the go, the new selection of games on Apple Arcade look absolutely beautiful on this giant screen. With the new processor, some of these games can almost stand up with console games in terms of graphics and quality. And lastly, the phone itself is absolutely beautiful to look at and hold. The three cameras took some getting used to at first but now they look great imo.

Heading: Amazing camera!
Text: Decided to upgrade from iPhone X. Amazing quality only Apple provides. Longer battery life, unbelievably fast, and pictures are amazing! Previous iPhone cameras were not good in low light or in settings with bright sun in background. Pro max delivers amazing photos and videos in all lighting. Wife initially upgraded to the Note10+, but changed to a Pro Max for the overall functionality and camera.

Heading: The bomb battery  liiiife
Text: I’m enjoying my upgrade I had the XS and I must say the battery life on this phone is the best one to date! The new square and battery upgrade was needed! I enjoy the cameras yes they’re lovely being that I’m a selfie gal but the battery is where it’s at period for me!!! I left it off the charger for a entire day and tada my phone didn’t die out! I’m a heavy user but during this time I kept it basic normal lighting, texting was over the top and I’d say social media 6 hours  off and on. My battery went down to 10%. I’m impressed!

Heading: Best ever!!!
Text:
I have been hard using Apple devices for the last 12 years, and I own almost all top devices under Apple brand and I have to say you that I have a big problem....

All my devices bought on the last 10 years are still working and I can’t imagine bring them to recycling, so I believe that I’m a few years I will have a persona museum to show to the new generations of my relatives part of the tech history!!!

Everything always can be better, and I’m sure that Apple devices are on the way to become day by day a little better ever!!!

Heading: If you’re military never deal with Best Buy
Text: If you’re looking for a military discount for your account do not go through Best Buy. They don’t have any idea of what the bill should actually be and don’t work for the carriers directly and will have absolutely zero answers when there is an issue. the phone is great but don’t do it....

I do hope it is not plagued with battery issues as so many modern day iPhones tend to have.   Its expensive !

Heading: Love the phone, hate the hassle of setting up

The phone now works great and looks amazing.

Heading: The best iPhone ever
Text:
I’ve had the iPhone 11 Pro Max for a little over a month now. I can say that this is hands down the best iPhone ever. It is very expensive yes, and it does what most other iPhones can do but this phone does it all so quick and smoothly. Every app loads up quick, and the battery life is outstanding. I take my phone off the charger at about 1pm and head out at 3pm. By the time I get home at around 1am I still have 50 to 60% battery life left. I use my phone quite a bit throughout the day to play Pokémon go lol and watch YouTube / browse the web and social media. 
The camera is also remarkable, especially when shooting video. It takes the best video I’ve seen on a smartphone, I always shoot at 4K 60fps and it’s crisp and pretty. Especially in low light / concerts. The screen on this iPhone is very bright and colors pop nicely. It’s my favorite smartphone ever. I know this phone is very expensive, but If you’re a “power user” and want a great camera on your phone, then I think it’s worth the money. Skip the base model and get at least 256gb though. You’ll quickly eat up storage if you take a lot of video.

Heading: Great at everything!
Text: Recently tried my hand with the galaxy S10+, it was a really good phone but I was missing my iPhone.  So I ordered the Pro Max after reading the improvements.  While it looks extremely similar to the last gen iPhone it’s so much more.  The cameras are phenomenal, better than my galaxy by far in pictures and video.  The speed and smoothness of IOS is unrivaled by any operating system I have tried.  Oh and the battery... I can’t believe this is an iPhone, I’m a very heavy user and can make it all day easily without having to worry about having a charger near by.  I was highly impressed with the S10+ battery, the iPhone exceeds what it could do.  I’m not thrilled about the price, but if you’re here you already the iPhone is very expensive.  If you’re on the fence and have the money available just go ahead and do yourself a favor and upgrade.

Heading: Definitely the best iPhone to date...that camera
Text:
I was unable to find the iPhone 11 Pro Max anywhere. They were out of stock everywhere ya looked. I was able to locate a few gray ones in 64 GB at the Best Buy in Chapel Hill.

Dylan Seibel was a great help if I may add. He knew all the ins and outs and details to get me the best deal on a trade in / port to Verizon.

Got $450 for my iPhone 8 Plus. Got a $200 MasterCard gift card, and free Unlimited Apple Music for the term of my contract.

Do auto-pay and get another $10 off. Veteran? Get another $15 off monthly.

Can’t beat it.

Oh. And that camera on this model is: Wow. I posted some sample pics I took. Battery: Another wow. Love the OLED super bright screen, too. If you’re on the fence, jump over it. You won’t regret buying the IPhone 11 Pro Max.

Thanks, BestBuy / Verizon / Dylan Seibel.
