Heading: Love the form factor
Text: Awesome, awesome phone. I love the screen and speed of the device. Face recognition works extremely well. I love how much smaller it is in your hand and pocket than the plus versions of previous models. My only annoyance is that I purchased it online without seeing it. The screen is stated to be bigger than the plus versions of the 6,7, and 8 but the phone is overall smaller because of the narrow bezels. While it technically is true, in the sense of diagonal inches, it is very narrow and tall, so the extra space is unusable. I came from a 7plus and while the screen was technically smaller diagonally, while using it, it felt larger. Because of the narrowness of the X screen, the keyboard is actually smaller than I was used to. All things considered though, great phone.

Heading: Awesome Phone, awesome screen!

After much time with it and using all of my regular apps on it, I can say that I now prefer the no home button full-screen display over the old one. I love just now big the screen looks and with the button gone, I feel like its so much more modern. Thank you apple, best buy!

The only thing it might take me awhile to get used to is not having the home button for fingerprint recognition. The face recognition is iffy at times. When I'm in a low light situation, it doesn't recognize me. I miss my fingerprint access. Other than that, it's a great phone and I don't expect anything less from Apple.

Heading: Best iPhone
Text: Best iPhone on the market. X has all the features most people need.

Heading: LOVE
Text: Everything about this phone is incredible! The camera is phenomenal! It makes them look professionally done. The speakers make your music sound like you are actually front row at a concert and the face unlocking is out of this world and so simple!

Heading: Nice Phone
Text: This phone is expensive but never had issues with it! User friendly! Apple is a great product

Heading: good phone so far
Text: I have never wanted an iphone but my entire family convinces me and the transition from a Samsung has been a little challenging but I like the phone now and my wife loves that I now have an iphone too

Heading: Great iPhone, Amazing Phone
Text: This phone is absolutely fantastic. Coming from an iPhone 7, this phone is blazing fast and incredibly beautiful with its high resolution 5.8” OLED display. I have no complaints at all with this phone and quite frankly I can’t believe this is an iPhone. Definitely recommend to anyone and everyone.

Heading: Amazing phone!
Text: Been an iPhone fan for years. Upgraded to this from the iPhone 5. While I was hesitant about the new face unlock feature, I don’t think I’ll be able to go back to a phone that doesn’t have it. I also don’t miss the home button like I thought I would. Great phone!!!

Heading: Amazing phone!
Text: Been an iPhone fan for years. Upgraded to this from the iPhone 5. While I was hesitant about the new face unlock feature, I don’t think I’ll be able to go back to a phone that doesn’t have it. I also don’t miss the home button like I thought I would. Great phone!!!

Heading: Love it!
Text: Bought it for my daughter, she has been so satisfied she wants me to get same one for myself

Heading: Perfect size to hold with one hand
Text: Perfect size to hold with one hand welcome change  from iPhone 7  plus.

Heading: Big and easy to use
Text: Great phone, easy to use and easy to read. I would purchase this item again.

Heading: Great
Text: our son decided to switch to apple.  So far he really likes it

Heading: Intuitive
Text: Of all the upgrades to the iPhone X, none are more impressive than the camera features. I purchased this a little early specifically for a family vacation and the pictures/video were nothing short of professional. As my grandson said, I could have spent twice as much on a professional camera and gotten poorer quality pictures.

Heading: Great phone!
Text: Great phone.  Big improvement over iPhone 7. Love the speed and the camera!

Heading: Unexpectedly Great!
Text: My last phone was an iPhone 7 Plus. It costs. me about $960.00 so the price on this was not necessarily an issue. I was disappointed in the iPhone X design when it was unveiled and the price was pretty daunting. However, I was pleasantly surprised. After a very short time I no longer noticed the notch and, as much of a sceptic as I was, the Face ID is really cool.

Heading: Excellent Deal
Text: My first iPhone and I picked a good one. Huge GB storage at a great price. Just the right size

Heading: Apple wins again!
Text: I’m a true Apple lover and the XS Max didn’t disappoint. I love the larger screen size and the portrait mode makes pictures turn out amazing!

Heading: I absolutely love this phone
Text: This phone is just fabulous. I don't miss the home button at all. The facial recognition doesn't work as perfectly as I had hoped, but I am still giving it 5 stars. You just have to be sure the phone is held up and aimed right at your face. I feel it is highly over priced really, but then again, it is a great product. I wouldn't consider any other phone but an iPhone.

Heading: FANTASTIC!
Text: I was hesitant about spending the money for the X, but figured I use my phone more than any other device in life, so might as well splurge. This thing is fantastic. The facial recognition log in is excellent - I don't even think about the phone pulling up at all any more. It just opens. Battery life is excellent as well as speed. Good job Apple and good deal Best Buy.

Heading: Very Nice iPhone
Text: Loving the iPhone X, jailbroken on iOS 12.1.1 beta, this phone is nice and fast!!!!

Heading: It’s an iPhone
Text: I cannot remember if I had issues with previous models, but I am noticing the battery drains much quicker than it used to.

Heading: Love it!
Text: Way better than my 6s plus. Face recognition works well and can always put the code in if it’s too dark or something is obstructing my face.

Heading: Such an amazing phone in all categories
Text: The phone has such good sound but it could be improved so it's as loud as the galaxy phones--- the quality and resolution pixels cannot beat anything else

Heading: Great
Text: Nice phone.my son loves it.will buy again for my other kids.

Heading: Good deal
Text: Shopped for a new phone at the right time with the Sprint promotion in Best Buy 50%OFF for this IPhone X 256GB...wow...I love this phone.

Heading: New Apple X smart phone...
Text: The previous 2 smart phones we had were Samsung (latest Galaxy S6). I got tired of reinstalling apps on my wife's phone after an Android upgrade. Also, my wife got proficient with reconnecting to the home WiFi after an Android upgrade. So far we have had one Apple OS upgrade and no issues except my wife had problems telling the OS that she did NOT want to use Apple Pay...

Heading: iPhone X
Text: I finally decided to upgrade from my 7plus and I love the decision. The X is pricey but the design and functionality are great. Kudos to Apple once again.

Heading: Great phone for wifey
Text: Hmmm made wife so happy to see a new iPhone X ready to use and abuse. :-)

Heading: Worth the upgrade
Text: Love the larger screen area and the Retina display. Facial recognition takes some getting used to and doesn’t always work but it’s a great phone.

Heading: Nice phone
Text: I'm not an Apple fan but I have to give credit where it is due. Bought this phone for my daughter - graduation gift. Built really well and has a smooth and efficient OS. Only negative is pricing. It could be a little less expensive. Certainly a great gift for a deserving child ; )

Heading: First IPhone in 10 years
Text: I have been an avid Android user, I hated the first 2 iPhones I had, I switched to Android and never looked back. I took a risk when I decided to take a chance on this phone, I have NOT been disappointed!

Heading: Great phone
Text: The iPhone X is a great upgrade to the iPhone. The increased use of space for the screen makes the screen looks beautiful. The facial recognition works flawlessly, and the phone is the perfect size. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to upgrade from a lower model phone, especially because the 8 is not much different from the 7.

Heading: New iPhine
Text: I need to upgrade my phone and this new I phone has all the function I need .

Heading: iPhone X
Text: I have loved every iPhone I have owned since my first 4s ! That being said they are getting too pricey & although I love the added security of apple products I’m not sure they are worth it anymore in relation to new features offered. Last two I owned I felt the value for price paid just isn’t there when you compare to comparable android models. First time I’m giving an iffy review of an apple product ever.

Heading: Close to perfect
Text: The iPhone X is a beautiful phone. The new oled display is beautiful, going edge to edge and with a notch at the top. Some may not like the notch, but you get used to it. Apple FINALLY releases wireless charging into an iPhone, so this is nice. The phone has a premium feel with the stainless steel frame, and glass back. Face ID is a nice concept, but I’d rather have a finger print reader on the back. If you place your phone down on a table you’ll find yourself leaning over to get into view for the Face ID to work. Besides that the only complaint I have is the price of the phone.

Heading: Nice size
Text: Love my new iPhone. It does everything i need in s phone.

Heading: Good phone and not hetty
Text: Bought this phone for my friend who has recently come to USA. I personally use Samsung Galaxy Note 8. The phone becomes slow at times. My wife use iPhone X and I was amazed to see the performance. Except camera, I believe rest of the phone is far better than Samsung Galaxy Note 8. Awesome product.

Heading: Love my X!
Text: It was a hard sell because I was afraid of losing the home button, but I’m so glad I did it! I love this iPhone so much! It was so easy to learn and now I’ll never go back!

Heading: Got as a birthday gift
Text: Love the Face ID so much faster than typing in passwords

Heading: Favorite iPhone in a long time
Text: First time in years and years that a new iPhone feels like a NEW phone. Love it. Very easy to adjust to the lack of a home button. No headphone jack which can be irritating

Heading: Amazing
Text: I upgraded from the iPhone 6s Plus. So far the battery is fantastic the speed is second to none. I I was skeptical about the facial unlock verses the fingerprint but I have to say I prefer the facial unlock over the fingerprint. No need to worry about taking your gloves off in the winter to unlock your iPhone! It’s amazing and I would highly recommend it.

Heading: Best iPhone Yet
Text: I replaced my iPhone 6s Plus with the X. It took a little bit to get used to the removal of the home button, but now I love it. The Face ID works great except when I am laying in bed at night. The camera is truly better than any camera I have ever owned. Apple fan for life.

Heading: Great phone if you only want the best
Text: I had an iPhone 5S until earlier this year. I decided to try the Samsung Galaxy 8. After 5 months, I decided to trade it in for the iPhone X. It is so much better. Much easier to use Apple CarPlay than android auto with both of my chevys. Alexa is also easier to use than Bixby.

Heading: My new iPhone X
Text: I am delighted with my new iPhone X. I looked at it in March but did not purchase it, however, last week I decided to look at it again and I bought it. It is easy to use and has a lot a nice features, some of which I haven't even toyed with yet. All in all, I am glad I bought it.

Heading: Smooth phone
Text: As an iPhone user for many years I can say this version is good as most of the upgrades are, the only thing is that most apps still don’t have support for the faceid and loops themselves sometimes & if your life is attached to having a home button you’re going to crazy the 1st weeks trying to get used to it, so overall is good..: expensive but good

Heading: iOS is the best
Text: I have had an iPhone ever since the very first model has come out. They are easy to use and can do so much and are capable of a multitude of things.

Heading: Simply the BEST!
Text: Upgraded from a 6 Plus and there is no comparison! I think skipping an upgrade cycle makes the technological improvements quite a bit more noticeable. Face recognition is working very well, I'm working on multiple self photos so I can fire up the phone while wearing sunglasses!

Heading: A perfect upgrade
Text:
This phone has all the cool features Apple is known for. The size is perfect, especially since the screen i larger than my outgoing 7+. The Face ID takes some getting used to after years of fingerprint security.

The processor is super fast too.

Heading: New phone (a while ago)
Text: When these first came out however many months ago, my husband would have no rest until we got them. So we did. They are nice. A little bit big, but otherwise nice. Sorry for the crazy late review.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Have always loved IPhones—this does not disappoint. Took a little getting used to no “home button”—but now seems intuitive. Great photos—still learning features. Seems very sturdy too.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Tons of storage. Perfect size and weight. Works the same as all Apple products.

Heading: Best iPhone you can get
Text: The X, imho, is the best iphone to date. I like it better than the XR or XS and would recommend to anyone looking to upgrade.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Best Buy was offering an upgrade special so we took advantage. Great phone. Vivid display. Nice new features.

Heading: Best phone
Text: My wife just love her phone works even better when you add a Apple Watch

Heading: Memojis are hilarious!
Text: At first I wasn't impressed. Unlocking with my face seemed like a gimmick (and kind of still is), but the Memojis are so fun. I needed an upgrade and got this on Sprint's upgrade deal.

Heading: Best Upgrade
Text: Coming from the 7, this is an upgrade in battery life, screen space, and hard disk space. One of the better iPhones yet IMO.

Heading: Iphone
Text: Great phone think battery last longer in this one than the car. Prefer this over XX. Have both

Heading: Best iPhone Ever
Text: I had bought the iPhone 8 Plus thinking their might be some major issues considering this was a big redesign not just for the hardware but the UI software as well. Man was I completely wrong and thank goodness my stepdaughter had an upgrade due. This phone is amazing and the new UI is great. Very fluid motions and beautiful screen. A must buy for a tech lover.

Heading: Great new iPhone and easy to operate
Text: iPhone is same except for no buttons now on the iPhone 10 X instead u swipe to do everything now. It took a minute but now I’m used to it and like it way better.

Heading: Huge upgrade from previous years IPhones.
Text: It’s an excellent phone, fast and sleek. I love the full screen, but it was a good week to get used to no button on the bottom.

Heading: Best camera yet
Text: My wife loves her new iPhone she bought it for the camera and it didn’t disappoint. Battery life is about two days with no charge

Heading: Best iPhone Yet!
Text: It was a little difficult to get used to the iPhone X for the first day or two, but I absolutely love the new technology and especially the new camera and its features! Apple has made a major improvement to it’s camera and capabilities. As all Apple products are it’s very user-friendly and capable of so much more than my one year-old iPhone 7!

Heading: iPhone X
Text: Apple products are great for the most part. A little pricey, but that’s nothing new. I love the sleek design of this phone, the sound is amazing and it takes fabulous photos. I think that it has as much memory as the first computer that I ever owned, maybe more! But it is so much faster! HaHa!

Heading: love my new phone
Text: I love my new phone just having a hard time with out the start button

Heading: The most advanced iPhone yet
Text: I ordered this on the first day and it arrived in only 1 week. I had an issue when paying for the phone at the store but I won't hold that against the iPhone. I really like the size and got used to the new changes very quickly. I would say go for the iPhone 8 or X depending on what the current price and your preference is. You will be happy with either one.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Good camera quality, overall very satisfied with purchase.

Heading: Great iPhone for the new upgrade
Text: I got the black iPhone X and I really love how simple this iPhone is versus the different iPhone X that there are now. Just like the iPhone 8 plus except the face recognition and fullscreen

Heading: It's an Iphone
Text: Aside from all the fancy new features and bezeless display, it is an iPhone with IOS11. You can probably get the same features in the iPhome 8 and save a few bucks. The X is a lot smaller than I thought it would be so keep that in mind if you are coming from a larger phone.

Heading: New phone
Text: Battery life is good. Phone works great. I washed my last one, bought on Best Buy and picked up later that day. Doesn’t get more easy than that.

Heading: great self portrait camera
Text: The portrait feature can now be used for selfies and there’s new filters to go with it. I love the stage lighting filter. It blacks out everything around you and makes you look like a giant sticker placed on a black background.

Heading: Beautiful
Text:
Got this for my sister in law for her upgrade with AT&T. I always upgrade with bestbuy. They are so much easier to deal with then the actual phone service retail associates. 

We got her the silver and it looks beautiful. I cant stop staring at it.

Heading: Great so far
Text: I have only had the phone for about two weeks now. But so far no problems at all. The battery with me using it a lot last’s around 8 hours. That’s with my Apple Watch paired to it also.

Heading: iPhone
Text: Love the phone. Hesitant to leave my iPhone 7. Very easy to use.

Heading: Best iPhone
Text: My wife and I both had iPhone 7 Pluses and enjoyed the big screen, but found it awkward to type. This has a much better looking screen that is almost as large in a smaller package.

Heading: Best iPhone yet!
Text: I purchased the iPhone X even though I heard reviews of it not being worth the money. I absolutely love this phone. I love that is is less bulky but you have a larger screen. Fits into wristlets where my iPone 6 Plus did not. The face recognition is one of my favorite features. I don’t miss the button! It was a slight learning curve but I love it!

Heading: Love the phone.
Text: Upgraded from a 5S and love it. There are more features and benefits.

Heading: Love
Text: Love the iPhone X! Wasn’t sure I could get used to the no home button, but after a few hours I forgot it even once existed. Love this phone!

Heading: First iPhone
Text: Long time android user. Nexus and Pixel. The iPhone X has a superb build. Screen is great. Very fast. Camera is equal to or better than any other phone. I’m an Apple guy now.

Heading: Water resistant & great camera
Text:
The X is amazing.
I did a 13 day trip down the Colorado River through the Grand Canyon with it in my pocket!

Heading: Love my phone!
Text: The camera is amazing and the fact that you can take selfies in portrait mode is awesome!! Love love love!!

Heading: Great evolution of the iPhone
Text:
The iPhone X has a jaw-dropping OLED screen and top-tier camera. 
The wireless charging works great and the speed of the phone is wonderful.

Heading: Easy and friendly to use.
Text:
Ive had every iphone that has came out after the 3G , and i mist say “ that i really do love this phone “ !
Especially the face recognition! I no longer have to use my fat large thumb multiple times to get into my phone . Just a simple tap to turn on ,or the phone itself knwoing you picked it up and looking at it . So that it unlocks! I love it !

Heading: LOVE IT!!!
Text: Beautiful....no words to describe....so happy!!! 2happy with my decision to get this phone! And it is soooooooo much better than my old phone! Get it

Heading: iPhone X
Text: iPhone X is a wonderful device. It was a bit cumbersome for me to figure out how to do all the other things I used to on my previous iPhones but the Best Buy Mobile staff is the best. They took time to explain all the features I had questions about....and well, candidly, YouTube taught me more stuff. :) Buy iPhone X

Heading: Love the camera!
Text: Awesome camera. Love the easiness of the Face ID! Love apple and all its user friendly options!!!

Heading: Great product
Text: Like the wide display and screen quality. Battery life much better than the previous Iphone 6s that I had

Heading: Great. Best iPhone yet.
Text: Bought this for my wife. We’ve owned many iPhones and this one has the best screen by far. The lack of home button is not missed. We’ve done comparisons by playing the same movie at the same time on the iPhone X and a iPhone 7plus and the X’s screen is so much better. The cameras are the best too.

Heading: Apple
Text: Love it absolutely love it Apple at its best would definitely recommend it to anyone that is in the Apple do love it better than Android

Heading: Nice phone
Text: Iphone X is a nice phone but takes some getting used to with no home button and having to use facial recognition or pass code. Swiping, closing and more are all different so don't expect to pick it up and use it like any other iPhone. Overall im very happy with the size and speed and would buy it again.

Heading: Slick and nice large screen
Text: The iPhone X is a choice unit. To match the Samsung, they expanded the screen to cover the whole unit and it's pretty sweet. Resolution is unreal; very crisp and clear. However, it also shows smudges a lot more than the previous models, but that's a small price to pay for an overall nice phone!

Heading: Easy to use
Text: I bought this phone to replace my old one and the transaction was very smooth.

Heading: Love it
Text: I was very skeptical at first on buying my iPhone X but after having it for a couple weeks, I absolutely love it. I upgraded from an iPhone 6s So this is a big jump for me but highly recommend it for everybody else. If you have an iPhone 7 or 8 do not upgrade. It would seem worthless for you.

Heading: Love It
Text: Bought this upgrade for my wife. It has a slight learning curve due to the different/updated features from her previous iPhone, but she loves it!

Heading: Very Good
Text: I love my new phone! Upgraded from an iPhone7 so no more home button but now I have to swipe up. It’s all about that swiping game now. Should’ve waited to get the iPhoneXS Max though..

Heading: Meh?
Text:
I love this phone but, it took a long time for get there? 
Way to expensive for what you get.

Heading: Omg!!!!!
Text: I live my iPhone! This is the best one they’ve made yet. Not having the button takes some getting used to but it’s sooo worth it.

Heading: Great device, bit expensive
Text: I bought it for my son going to college. I could have waited a few days to buy the latest version however my son didn’t care for the “improvements” in the newer version. Besides this was cheaper by $100. He loves it.

Heading: It’s an iPhone !!! Need I say more
Text: It’s not perfect but then again, it comes pretty close to it. Closer then anyone else. Love it. Not really happy about the battery percentage not being displayed but I’ve learned to live with it. Small learning curve with the new gestures but very easy to get used to and within the first few hours you’ll feel at home with it. Recommend.

Heading: Best phone ever
Text: The IPhone X is my first iPhone having been a longtime Android user. This phone pushed me to switch and I could not be happier. This is by far my favorite phone ever and could not be happier with the ease of use, features and functionalities.

Heading: Love my Phone!!
Text: This iPhone is wonderful! I love the Face ID and the larger screen. I previously had an iPhone 6 Plus, so the change in the device size is a welcome one. The camera is AH-Mazing! The OLED screen is also a nice feature. Videos show very well. It’s easy to adjust to not having a home button. I don’t miss it at all! I would definitely recommend the purchase!

Heading: IphoneX
Text: I have wanted this phone for a long time. Best Buy has a great deal on it so I bought it. I have had 2 iPhones before this one. It is a great phone; love the camera on it!!

Heading: Surprised
Text: Didn’t think I’d like the Face ID but it works well. The size of the phone is better than the previous model and the sound and video is a huge improvement.

Heading: Love it
Text: Didn’t think I’d like the Face ID but it works well. The size of the phone is better than the previous model and the sound and video is a huge improvement.

Heading: Great phone
Text: Great phone to replace my iPhone 6. Love the Face ID, but sometimes miss the finger ID. Much faster than my old phone, and once you get used to how to navigate without the home button, it’s a breeze!

Heading: Love my new phone!
Text: Upgrades are always nice! Definitely nice going from a 7 to a X!

Heading: Excellent
Text: Very fast and easy to use. No problems with this unit

Heading: Great!
Text: I've really enjoyed this phone since day one. It took about a day for the learning curve without a home button, but now it is second nature. I replaced a Galaxy S8+ that was buggy and crashed all the time. This phone takes great pics, has excellent battery life, and has worked flawlessly without crashing once. Great investment!

Heading: So fast and easy to use
Text: I didn’t think it would be any different. I had the iPhone 7Plus and I loved it and didn’t want to leave it, but once I saw how beautiful the iPhone X was I immediately fell in love with its aesthetic features and its size. It’s smaller yet bigger screen.

Heading: Best. iPhone I ever owned
Text: This iPhone is the best yet I have owned just about every version of the iphone very few dropped calls but that is because of the service in the area,Verizon is putting up a mini tower in back of my house which I think will stop the dropped calls

Heading: Great phone
Text: The battery last all day and the pictures are true and vibrant.

Heading: Amazing phone
Text: Great phone to use. Picture quality awesome. Really enjoying it

Heading: Face recognition doesn’t always work
Text: Face recognition doesn’t always work. It’d be much more helpful if the thumbprint option would pop up. Having to type in a password is still a bit of a nuisance, but I appreciate the fact that it still works with sunglasses on. Also, face recognition works in the dark, sometimes. The way to fully close apps takes additional steps versus swiping up on other iPhones. It’s not exactly a smooth transition from the other iphones. Does take a lot of getting used to. Camera quality is great, but I would recommend sticking to the iPhone 8 for the price.

Heading: Happy Iphone X owner
Text: At first, I wasn't sure about this product due to the price. But, after doing some research I came to the conclusion that the functionality of this device justifies the price. Once again Apple delivered an excellent product.

Heading: Favorite iPhone
Text: This is by far my favorite iPhone and I’ve had almost all of them since the 4. The face recognition is the best feature

Heading: Love it!
Text: I have small hands so having the larger phones is hard for me to hold with just one hand. And I can’t be holding my phone with two hands all the time! This phone is a great size compromise for holding and the screen is the winning number! Goes out to the edges!

Heading: Glass Protector
Text: I higher recommend the glass protector for your phone. It’s so clear that you can not notice it on the phone but it protects the screen from breaking and it has a lifetime warranty

Heading: Great product
Text: Versatile phone equipped with all the features you need to stay connected on the go.

Heading: Camera
Text: Love this item ! Bought it for my sister who lives all the way in Marshall Islands where the scenery is beautiful and she was able to catch it with a awesome camera quality! Not only back , but front also . Love love it

Heading: Best IPhone Ever!!!!!
Text: The smart phone on steroids!!! Oled screen is awesome! Camera is bad to the bone! And to top it all off besides the facial recognition and fast processor, huge viewing screen!!! I’m a iPhone geek for life!!!

Heading: Fantastic phone
Text: I bought this for my wife and she loves it. Face ID works as promised. The screen is the best I’ve seen on any iPhone.

Heading: A great smart phone
Text: The best camera, Siri, quality components. What is there not like about an Apple phone. It pair effortlessly to the Apple Watch and AirPods. Backup is automatic to the Apple cloud.

Heading: Newest Technology
Text: I got this phone for my son and it is great. The camera is the best I've seen and the graphics are great, too. Best iphone yet.

Heading: Pleased
Text: I’ve had the phone for a while now and overall it is a good product. Not sure if I like the facial recognition better or the fingerprint recognition from my last phone better. Takes great pictures.

Heading: My girlfriend really liked this phone!
Text: My girlfriend thought this phone was light years ahead of her old iPhone 7. It has so many features, she probably won't find all of them by the time she thinks this phone is out of date.

Heading: Amazing features
Text: In love with all the new features! Only thing that can be annoying is if you have face id set up and look at the phone after a missed call, it automatically calls them back. Don’t have a single complaint about the phone & so glad they did away with the home button

Heading: Great camera
Text: This was such a step up. Love the portrait feature. An incredible phone. I do miss the button but I have adjusted. I also miss the fingerprint scanner instead of face recognition.

Heading: This iPhone is great!
Text: I’ve been a huge Apple fan for a long time and this by far is one of my favoreites. I usually get the plus models but decided to try something a little more pocketable and I now am in love with the size and feel of this phone. As for Face ID, it has definitely grown on me.

Heading: iPhone X
Text: So far it’s great except for only having it for less than a week and the face recognition stopped working and I had to get the phone replaced. Other than that I love all the new features it has that the other iPhones don’t.

Heading: Amazing phone
Text: Upgraded from the 6 plus and boy am I glad! Fyi, you don’t need to setup Face ID if you don’t want to! You can still do swipe up to unlock and punch in your password and voila! Great alternative for those that don’t like having to set up Face ID and having your face stored somewhere.

Heading: Good Phone But Pricey
Text: Ive had an Android phone of over 20 years and the iPhone X is my first Apple phone. Its a bit of a learning curve but I love Apple products in general and expect to love this phone as well as time goes by. The only thing I prefer with the Android phones over the iPhone is the adjustabbility of the main screen (which is really not a big deal). I gave the 4 stars review because I haven't had enough time yet to see all the pros and cons.

Heading: Great camera and screen
Text: Good purchase and I recommend to everyone to enjoy

Heading: Big Screen on a Small Phone
Text: I love the bigger screen of the iPhone X while maintaining the small phone size. The camera is awesome, and the features it offers are great. I was hesistant about no home button, but I have come to love that and the facial recognition to unlock the phone.

Heading: Sister sister
Text: Love sisters reaction to see her new iPhone X.  OMG :-0

Heading: This iPhone X is AMAZING
Text: I wasn't sure I wanted this new phone until I was having trouble with my 7,but the retina scanning is the most amazing this I have seen in a while. It really works well and is so hassle free when it comes to using the phone. This is jus one of the many features I love, the other is the sharpness of the new camera. Well done Apple!

Heading: Gift for my girls
Text: Best Buy is the best place to buy phones, the girls love these devices. Very high quality, Apple is always pricey, but they hold there resale value better than any other phone.

Heading: Best iPhone to date
Text: I've been an Android guy for nine years waiting for it to be worth it to switch. It would take a lot of features to compete with the customization available from an Android. And the iPhone X is jam-packed with features. Seamless integration with my iPad and Macbook Pro also helped me make the jump.

Heading: iPhone x
Text: Love this phone. The screen is vibrant, good battery life, don’t miss the home button. Only issue I have is I take a lot of screen shots trying to adjust the volume.

Heading: Wow and wow
Text: Got this for my wife and she absolutely loves it. Has more than enough space for all her pictures and videos. She loves the camera as the pictures are beautiful. It's an iPhone and that's all that needs to be said.

Heading: Nice
Text: I want to love this phone, but I've had nothing but problems since the moment I got it. I upgraded from an iPhone 6s. I've had more problems with this brand new X than I did with the old 6s and Apple can't even figure out why!!!!! GRRR....Even Verizon has tried to help. They, Apple, made a couple of stupid changes, but a lot of nice changes as well.

Heading: Oh my...
Text: My wife was very excited about upgrading to the iPhone X as her sister has one as well. The features of the phone are as she wanted, however, within 2 weeks there was bright green line on the screen so we took it to an APPLE store. They had to send it out to be fixed. When it was ready to be picked up we found that they had just sent her a new phone, that should have been the first warning. Now after owning the phone for a little over 4 months the battery is failing. It shows 100%, but unexpectedly shuts off. When you try to turn it on it says that the battery is low. After plugging it in and the phone turns on it shows that the battery is at 100%...Taking it in (again) to be fixed. For the cost of this device you think it would last longer.

Heading: Not Too Sure Yet
Text:
Im honestly not very impressed with this phone. I was under the impression Apple was designing this phone with the ability to essentially be used as a computer, with connectivity to a keyboard and display. This is not a feature I would use often or is of great importance, but it is innovation and could help support the price of this.

Additionally, why make this in all glass? (Aside from the fact that it will boost accessory sales as well as repair revenue).

This phone still acts glitchy and I got the unlocked version with 256GB memorory. The unlocked version has 4GB of RAM vs the traditional iPhone X models (Carrier Specifict Models). You can research this to confirm if you doubt this is correct.

I am at the point where I might just return the phone and either choose another alternative such as the Google2 phone or the BlackBerry KeyOne.

My life is cluttered enough, sometimes getting back to basics is most important. Especially when the difference in price is $700.00!

They should be wireless. Also, the fact that when restoring the phone from backup settings from your old device all the custom ringtones are deleted and not transferred over. Also, the call screen when in a call is a lil annoying when the screen goes asleep and wakes up and say you want to multitask so you have to swipe up from the bottom.... may accidentally end the call your on by hitting the end button.. these are just a few of the things that should be address for such and expensive phone Apple! Missing the mark with this phone.

Heading: Gimmicky.
Text: So Apple finally decided to redesign the iPhone and this is the result. I give them props for the overall look at the phone as well as finally upgrading the screen technology and adding wireless charging. However the gestures are not intuitive and face ID does not work nearly as well as they say it does unless you disable The required attention feature which makes the phone less secure. With this feature turned on it only works one in every five or six trials for me. It was a massive mistake for them to illuminate touch ID. If they were going to go all screen on the front that’s fine. But they should have put a fingerprint reader on the back of the phone like the rest of the industry. Hopefully they will rectify this in the second generation next year.

Heading: Beautiful phone
Text: I upgraded from a 7+ to the X. I loved my + but it finally died on me and was always just a little bit too wide for my hands and difficult to fit into pockets. The screen on the X is absolutely stunning, I am constantly in awe of how crisp and clear, how vibrant the colors look. The camera on the + was great but all the hype about the camera on the X is completely true to form. It’s incredible. I take a lot of pictures and videos of my horses and the quality is so much better on the X. I love that the phone isn’t quite as wide but has a larger screen size at the same time. It’s easier to handle and use, and much more comfortable. The phone is lightning fast and super responsive. The sound quality is excellent, no problems so far. I love the quick SOS feature built right in to the phone. All in all, this is a great device that has so far been a complete joy to use.

Heading: Glitchy!!!
Text: 5th iPhone I've owned and this is the first one I HATE! Repeatedly opens in landscape mode, have to close it and reopen multiple times a day! Gets hung up and freezes when trying to text more than one image, then again freezes for no reason at all! Open camera to take pic and there's just a blurry screen- again must close out and reopen, often several times! (Forget getting that spontaneous shot!) I got rid of my 6S thinking some of the occasional hiccups were due to its age-I should've kept it! Kept hoping updates would correct issues, they haven't and I see no online fixes. Did online chat w/Apple to make appt at local Apple Store and was told they currently have no iPhone appts available!!! (Looking 3 weeks out- Unbelievable.) And forget walking in to local store as they won't even talk to you without one!

Heading: Perfection
Text: I had been a longtime Samsung device user and had previously been using a much larger Samsung device. I realized that I needed a smaller phone that was manageable when using with only one hand. It is the perfect size. The camera on this device is great. Battery life is on par with my previous Samsung. Performance wise, it is extremely fluid and rarely slows down. I would recommend getting the necessary cable and adapter for fast charging. It charges incredibly fast. Overall, I would definitely recommend this device for anyone especially those who want top performance without the big size.

Heading: Best iPhone yet
Text: I’ve had almost every iPhone in the past and before this had the iPhone 7 Plus 128gb black. This phone is amazing. The screen is stunning and new features are a nice change. For the first few hours it can be quite a change navigating the new gestures of your a previous iPhone user but you quickly start t adopt to the new gestures quite easily. The sound is much better, wireless charging is a quite usable feature and yes animojis are quite fun. Face ID is great but the extra swipe in the beginning is a little taxing. Hopefully more apps will integrate Face ID from Touch ID as I have had to enter passwords where I previously used Touch ID as that is not an option as of yet. So in conclusion the iPhone X feels like an actual upgrade compared to the past of a few new features not a new phone. It’s defiantly worth the purchase as it is quite enjoyable.

Heading: iPhone X Defect
Text: My iPhone X expierence so far. Preordered on Oct. 27th and managed to get a Gray/Black 256GB Iphone X. Finally arrives on the 6th and I don’t get a chance to open it up and attempt to hook up my new phone until the 11th. So here I go beaming with excitement to check out my new device that just cost me the equivalent of a house payment. Open it up and everything looks good at first and then I use my iPhone 6S light to look at the screen for any dust as I’ve already gotten a screen protector in hand to put on my new device before I even get started. Then I see it. A very very small scratch or crack under the screen coming from the notch area at the top of the phone coming down maybe 1/2 a cm long. So I schedule an appointment to talk to an Apple rep. for 8:45am and he finally calls me at 8:48am. I explain to him what I observed on my phone and he doesn’t seem to thrilled to help me out today. Maybe because it’s a Saturday and he’s at work. During our conversation he makes a statement that I didn’t really care for. Such as... Maybe the delivery man dropped your package and maybe that’s what happened. Obviously this is a manufacturing defect since it’s under the screen. So I get two options. Option A) Send my phone in to be repaired and who knows how long that will take and why would I want a brand new item I just paid a lot of money for to be repaired due to a defect. Option B) Go to the Apple Store and have them look at it and I can try and request a new phone. Oh and the next available time I can get an appointment is 4 days away and I’ll have to take off work early to resolve an Apple manufacturing defect. So I guess we will see how my Apple Store experience goes. I’ve had an Apple phone going back to the 3GS days and I’ve dealt with Apple Customer Service in the past with no issues but so far I’d have to say I’m extremely disappointed in the quality control of the IPhone X and the customer service expierence with Apple. Hopefully all is redeemed on the 14th. To be continued...

Heading: Great product for a first time Apple user
Text:
I've never owned an Apple product but this year I took the plunge to move from Android (Pixel phones, Samsung phones) to get this iPhone 11. It was the right time for me to do so. With the changes and improves iOS13 brings (from all that I've read and watched in reviews/vids) and the camera upgrades from XR; the transition has been fairly easy. I know there is a learning curve for me as I slowly learn the iOS system. But I changed to have the best of both worlds. And it is true the Google apps in iOS do run better than on Android.

The phone performance has been stellar. NO lag. NO freezes. I had prepared myself to have a smooth experience with iOS, but I have still been surprised and pleased with the fluidity. Never have I experienced anything so smooth on any of the many Android phones I've used over the years. The battery is a superstar champ. It feels as if I cannot kill it if I were to try. Even though I am never far from a charging option, it is so refreshing to not feel battery anxiety.

Siri is WAY better than I was led to believe. In fact I find her to be more responsive and less buggy than Google Assistant - especially when using Apple CarPlay. This was a surprise to me due to all I've read. Voice to text is admittedly not as accurate as Assistant. 

I already knew the iPhone cameras take the best videos, but the updates to the photos themselves are phenomenal. The auto night mode is fantastic - I like it better than Pixel's Night Sight. It seems more natural. True the Portraits are sometimes not as well defined as on the Pixel phones - but that is something that is not a game changer for me. I like the fact that photos on the iPhone 11 are not over sharpened as is true on the Pixel lineup (I've had all 3 Pixel phones so I'm not spinning my wheels here).

True tone is fantastic. The color (mint green) is the prettiest color I've had on a phone. I have no issues with the LCD screen versus OLED - it's a great screen. The gestures are great and smooth and easy to learn. 

I've been so pleased with this that I'm not looking at (researching) buying one of the Macbook laptops (tablets are not for me). 

This is a fantastic phone. No looking back.

Heading: Great phone for the price
Text:
This review is based on upgrading from an iPhone X to an 11, hopefully it helps those who are in the same situation. 
There were a few reasons I chose to upgrade, I wanted a slightly bigger screen, I wanted better battery life, and I wanted better speed (I play quite a bit of games on my phone). I had also made the mistake of getting an X with only 64gb which was a bad idea to begin with. This phone fortunately covers all those issues. The battery life is great and the speed at which this phone opens apps is incredible. The camera with the wide angle is also a big bonus, I’ve never been a big photographer with my phones, but I’ve found myself using this phone a lot more for that purpose.
The one downside to this phone is the quality of the screen, this is more evident with the new dark mode in iOS13. Black screens on this phone aren’t really black, they’re more of a dark grey and this is due to the OLED vs LCD screen.
I still own my X and once I upgraded it to iOS13 I could see the difference in dark mode, on my X the black backgrounds seem truly black while on the 11 the blacks seem a little lighter. Does this make the upgrade not worth it? I guess it depends how much the lighter blacks bother you. Personally, after a month of use I don’t notice it much anymore.
At $749 for the 128gb I would highly recommend this phone, if the LCD screen bothers you that much then I would recommend going for the Pro but at the price point I’m not sure extra deep blacks are worth it.

Heading: Fantastic upgrade
Text: Upgraded to the 11, 128gb from an 8+ 256gb. Never needed 256 with the 8+ But that was the next size up from 64gb. 128gb is perfect. I’m able to keep all of my photos and all of my music on this phone with 60+gb left. A lot of talk about how the pro screen is so much better than the 11’s LCD screen. But going from the 8+ that already had an LCD, this screen seems sharper and more vibrant. The thing that really stands out is the speed. This thing just flies. I can click a link or open a new app and it loads almost as quickly as snapping your fingers. The camera on the 8+ was already pretty good, but again the 11 shines better here. I love the wide angle lense and the night mode. I used to hate taking low-light pics due to the flash making things seem so white. What I like most is gaining some screen size compared to my 8+, but in a smaller form factor. Overall I am extremely satisfied with my upgrade and would definitely do it again. For most people, the iPhone 11 is the upgrade that is worth every penny!

Heading: A screen I can see without the bulk of a PLUS
Text:
I left a 7 for this 11. It gives me a visual screen that I can see without the bulk of the iPhone 7+ which my husband is very happy with. 

It’s taken a bit to get the hang of it but I had excellent help getting started with the help of Joshua in the mobile department. Later I went back in to my geek Michael who went step by step through the questions that had cropped up. 

If you haven’t used anything past iPhone 8 be sure to play around and make a list of what you’re stuck on. Take it to mobile or geek squad. If it’s easier, call Apple. 

Enjoy your new iPhone!!!

Very important to me is that this phone doesn’t have the OLED screen. I’m extremely light sensitive and get migraines. This is the only phone I can use. If Apple  switches to all OLED screens in the future I’m off iPhone.

Heading: Amazing camera
Text: The only thing that really sperates phones these days seems to be the cameras. I had a pixel 2 xl (now on galaxy s10e) which takes the best pictures. My wife bought the iPhone 11 and I am thinking about switching to it. The camera is AMAZING. Battery life is great and the new iOS adds a lot of shortcuts that apple was missing. For 699 apple hit a home run with this phone. Even tho the screen is lower resolution the colors and brightness are astounding. I'm not an Apple fan but may be...I just haven't switched yet because I still love Android but I'm on the fence.

Heading: Best iPhone to this day! Right size right price.
Text: The iPhone 11 is an amazing phone. I had a XS Max before, and traded it in to get this, and I am so happy I did. This is what I consider the “Goldilocks” iPhone; it’s just right. The size, both screen and body, is perfect, being in between the 11 Pro and Pro Max. It’s not as good a screen as the Pro’s OLED, but it’s still pretty darn good. The colors are amazing and it still is a very high-definition screen. Why spend extra for a better screen? You’re getting the same processor, which is wicked fast, and ALL the same features as the Pro! I am so glad that I switched from the XS Max because I can enjoy all of the same great features of the Pro model for a fraction of the cost. I would HIGHLY recommend considering buying the 11 over the Pro series.

Heading: So many reasons this was a great gift
Text: My son had issues with his old phone and the thought of not being able to get a hold of each other at any time was upsetting to both of us. His old phone likely could have been repaired, but there was no guarantee. It made sense to buy a new phone and know that he not only had something reliable, but also something that had better features and more storage than his previous phone. He loved it and I love knowing that he appreciates the new phone as well.

Heading: Impressive New Version of the iPhone
Text: I had been using an iPhone 6s for several years but was having issues with battery life, the charging port, etc. so I decided it was time to update. I debated buying an older model rather than the iPhone 11 to avoid the use of Face ID but decided to go with the most recent model and think that was the right decision. The battery life is fantastic in comparison to my old phone, the picture quality is great and I am enjoying the slightly larger screen. I have still not turned on Face ID but may do so eventually which reduces the ease of use somewhat in comparison to the old thumbprint ID.

Heading: Great new phone
Text: I’m still getting used to my new iPhone 11 because it’s quite a bit different from my iPhone 6S Plus. I loved that phone but am starting to love my new iPhone 11 as well. I really like the red color to start with, but also all the new features, such as face recognition, swiping from one screen to the next & the camera takes really clear & pretty photos. There are many other options that I’m still learning, but overall I really like my new phone & would highly recommend it.

Heading: Nice upgrade!
Text: I've had an Apple 6+ iPhone for years and finally decided to purchase an upgrade to iPhone 11.  It's a really nice phone and the new features are cool. I wish these phones weren't so expensive but the quality and security this phone provides helps offset the price for me. I also have a MacBook Pro, so I like that I have 2 Apple products that are easy to sync.

Heading: Pretty big compared to iPhone 6
Text: I upgraded from an iPhone 6 to this iPhone 11 which is much larger, does not have the "button" to push on the screen (now need to swipe right) and does not allow charging and use of headphones at the same time - both use the same port.  Definitely something to get used to.  Some of my App. passwords transferred over, some did not.  I'm still not sure what the difference is in having 2 cameras instead of one.  Learning curve.

Heading: Best iPhone ever!
Text:
I moved up from an SE. What a difference!  Facial id makes sign on a breeze. You pick up the phone, look at it and boom you are in. Swoop up and there are your apps. Swoop up again to leave an app. 

Sound is good quality. I haven’t used the headphones so I can’t comment. 

This is the 64 gig model. The case is actually as large as the pro.

Heading: Real Nice Upgrade!
Text: Upgrading from a 6, this baby really is nice. Battery life is about twice as long, even after taking advantage of battery replacement on my old 6. Processing speed is astounding, app upgrades are super short. Display is large, bright and sharp. Size was more than I wanted, but it still fits in my front pocket. I thought the loss of the home button was going to be problematic, but in a few hours of use I was completely comfortable with swiping up. So much so that I get somewhat lost when I have to use my wife’s 7. The camera is much more capable than I need but I’m finding new uses as I discover features. The only downside is they didn’t give it to me for free!

Heading: Switched from Android to IOS
Text: I am new to an Apple IOS phone. There is a slight learning curve for a first time purchaser of an Apple product. I like the phone but, there are a few features I dislike. 1. I don't like that if I am away from my phone and receive a text message or phone call I have no way of knowing I have received either because, there isn't a light that will blink to let me know I have missed either. 2. I don't care for the camera to much. I don't see options to change my pictures such as, low lighting mode, panorama, and others I can't think of right now. 3. I don't like that I can not use some apps that I could on my android. 4. I don't like that I have to turn WiFi off each day from the top right corner pull down. Then it tells me it will turn it off until the next day and each day I have to go through that to turn it off.  If I go into settings and turn it off there, I am not able to use my hot spot. For it to be an Apple 11 (yes I know it's not the pro or pro max) you would think it would have more features. However, as I said I am new to Apple and it could just be that I have not figured things out.

Heading: Impressive New Version of the iPhone
Text: Bought this for my wife who had been using an iPhone 6s for several years but was having issues with battery life and fuzzy pictures so I decided it was time to update. I debated buying an older model for her rather than the iPhone 11 to avoid the use of Face ID but decided to go with the most recent model and think that was the right decision. The battery life is fantastic in comparison to her old phone, the picture quality is great and she is enjoying the slightly larger screen. She has been using Face ID but has not been thrilled with the functionality in comparison to the old thumbprint ID. She is also having to replace her phone holders due to the larger size.

Heading: Flawless
Text:
Lightning fast processor. My emails, reports, PDFs, app updates, everything! downloads so quickly. There is nearly zero wait time for apps that I have had to wait between 30 seconds and 2 minutes for my XR that I traded in.

Camera: the HD features of the 11 are pretty much useless if your subject is farther than 8 feet away. Also, depending on the angle of capture, faces of people can appear slanted or warped if they are on the edge of the shot; I understand this is hard to escape, due to the tiny lens creating a “walleye vision” effect just from the light passing through it. Physics is still unarguable, despite our digital prowess.

Heading: So far so good
Text: I went from an Android to an IPhone this time around. I was hoping the battery life would be better but not so much. It is a work in progress getting used to the difference in operating systems. The camera is good not much difference my my old phone. Over all pretty good.

Heading: Big upgrade from my wife's SE
Text: All works well. Pro tip, take the plastic screen protector from the factory off before trying to call or you and the person you're talking to will be frustrated. All works well, iOS transfer is great for mirroring devices. Camera was actually less clear than expected. Shots seem very grainy and not high quality when sending to other devices with higher resolution screens.

Heading: iPhone 11 is a great phone.
Text: I was cautioned before buying it about it not having a "home" button. It took me all of two minutes to get used to using the phone without one.  I like everything about this phone.

Heading: Second time was the charm
Text:
Got an iPhone 11 on Black Friday and for the first time ever in my Apple buying experience, the phone wouldn't work. It couldn't connect for some reason. After the great help at Best Buy, I was given this phone and it's been great ever since. Getting to know the new functions was pretty easy after having a 7 for so long. 

Great phone for a great cause.

Heading: This is a very good phone.
Text: My husband and I both bought one of these iPhone 11 phones. I thought this was a vast improvement over my iPhone 7. It seems to be a very easy to work with phone, now I just have to get used to IOS 13. I wish to commend both Terrell and Adrienne for the great jobs they did for us at the Verizon desk. I think they are a great asset for the Best Buy store in Mishawaka Indiana store.

Heading: The sweet spot in the iPhone line up
Text: I, like another reviewer, traded in an iPhone XS Max for the iPhone 11. No regrets! I like the size better, it has a brilliant screen, and saves me $15.00/month on my phone bill. I still have the features of the Pro series that matter to me and paying $400 less for it. All iPhones are great phones and I wouldn’t own anything else but for me the 11 hits all the marks for my needs at a reasonable price. If you’re on the fence about upgrading to the iPhone 11, go for it! You won’t regret it. It’s a great device!

Heading: So far , so good.
Text: Present for my son.  His old phone needed a serious upgrafe... so we went for it.  iphone 11.  He loves it! And going to Best Buy instead of going to our carrier... EXCELLENT!  Our Best Buy Rep was knowledgeable & honest... and it only took 20 minutes... seriously only 20 minutes.  We would have been at our carrier for 2 hours.  Ha!

Heading: Unlocked and Best Buy is the way to go.
Text: Bought a unlocked iPhone 11 from Best Buy.  The wireless rep was helpful and very quick in helping me add the phone to our account and finding the life proof case I wanted.  This is the 3rd unlocked phone we have purchased through Best Buy.  Highly recommend Best Buy for all your wireless needs.

Heading: Great batter life!
Text: This is my first iPhone and I love it so far. The battery life is much better than my google pixel. I do wish iPhones were a little more customizable, however that’s something I will get used to. I also love the night mode camera; it works super well!

Heading: Much needed upgrade
Text: The new iPhone 11 net every expectation and more for a holiday gift for my daughter. The sales associates knowledge and understanding of the product made the purchase even more special by explaining FL the functionality of the phone and upgrades over her previous phone. Win Win

Heading: So far so good.
Text: I did purchase the XR and the camera was terrible!  I could not understand how a Pixel 2 could be it.  This double camera seems to be a lot better.  I took a video in 4k, but I cannot watch it in 4k on the phone, a little strange, but OK.  Battery life is FANTASTIC.  The screen is bright.  Having a hard time with the sounds, either too loud or cannot hear it. But I like the phone, like IOS 13 and like the dual speakers on the bottom.

Heading: I switched to the dark side
Text: I am not a fan of apple.  However all of my kids have iphones and I was missing out on the interconnectivity that iphones have.  I have to admit that this phone has changed my mind about iPhones.  It wasn't as painful of a switch as I thought it would be.  This is a really nice phone and takes great pictures.

Heading: Rough start but a great phone
Text: I had some issues, probably from the IOS 13 bugs restoring this phone from a backup. It froze up, shut down and would not power on. After a visit to BB a tech got it back up running using vol up, vol down and power button combo unfroze the phone. After a couple of IOS 13 updates it works fine. Battery life is incredible! All day of sometime heavy use without a mid day boost. Love the wireless charging, but Apple should throw in a wireless charger rather than making us buy one separately. I huge update from my old iPhone 7.

Heading: Still getting used to it
Text: This phone replaced an iPhone 5 that was 6 1/2 years old.  I loved that smaller phone, but the battery was just getting weird.  I would lose 80% of my charge in just five minutes.  This phone probably has way more features than I will ever use.  I'm still getting used to swiping it, instead of hitting a home key.  Sadly, it no longer fits into "pockets" in my Baggalini purse, so now it's just in the main compartment.  Therefore, I bought a screen protector because I think it's more vulnerable now.  I also wasn't used to the fact that it turns on automatically whenever you touch it.  I was worried I would wear down the charge.  But I do see the benefit of being able to check the time without clicking anything.    The overall huge benefit is that, since I don't use it much, I don't even have to charge it once a day!  I guess it was just time to say goodbye to my trusty 5!  :-(

Heading: Holy Camera
Text: The cameras on the new iPhone 11 is fantastic. Battery life is substantially better than the iPhone X and the speed of apps to launch is in milliseconds. Quite impressed with this update and would recommend to anyone considering upgrading.

Heading: Excellent upgrade
Text: This was purchased as a gift for someone upgrading from an iPhone SE so the difference in quality was immediately noticed. All of the new features really made a difference in the user experience. The deal I found through Best Buy got us a better price than directly from either Apple or Verizon. Very pleased.

Heading: Another great smartphone from Apple!
Text:
I replaced my iPhone 6 with this phone.  I'm very pleased with it so far.  I'm glad I have 64GB of storage now-- I used to have 16.

The only thing I've had to get used to is that this phone is larger in size than than the one I used to have.  Other than that, it's been a very smooth transition.

Heading: Like bery much.
Text: Haven’t had a chance to use the camera much but I’m sure it will be really good. So nice not running out of memory. Increased from 16 g with my 6S to 128 gwith my 11.

Heading: Best value iPhone!
Text: This is hands down the best iPhone you can buy for your money. It has the same cameras (minus the telephoto) and processors as the 11 Pro! Not to mention it has a super long battery life that lasts all day with constant use!

Heading: I am really enjoying my upgrade to iPhone 11.
Text: I was surprised to find a better deal from Best Buy than from my provider for my upgrade from iPhone 6 to iPhone 11. I am loving the upgrade! It was an easy transition. No more error messages telling me to manage my storage before I can take a picture or update my apps.

Heading: The sound/camera/battery life is great
Text: Sounds like the speaker is in the back, the new surround sound system in this phone is amazing. This camera is no joke and worth buying if your don’t want to buy an actual camera, portrait mode is awesome. You can play music/be online/Play games and you will still have battery by the time you get home. Very impressed with the new iPhone 11

Heading: Fast and beautiful design.
Text:
Coming from iPhone 7 Plus (128gbs) the upgrade was definitely big change. I opted for extra storage for additional $$$. I still can't believe Apple refuse to make 128 or 256 as a standard size for $700-$1000 device. 

+Color
+Camera
+Size

One negative is the LCD display but I knew that before making my purchase.

Heading: Great Phone
Text: Delightful upgrade from my iPhone 7. I’m. Glad I waited for the iPhone 11. I haven’t used the camera much yet and I’m still getting used to more swiping and no home button. But I am very happy with this phone.

Heading: Great phone for a great price
Text: I’m not really good at reviews but here goes. So I had an iPhone 7 until I bought this. I got used to not having a home button in twenty minutes after using this phone. The swiping is so easy and Face ID is amazing. Having two cameras stabilizes the angle of your outward facing photos taken. YouTube reviewers had shown the same images taken with both an XR and 11 and the position of the photo images made the focus more in the middle whereas the XR would change the angle a tiny bit to where certain objects being focused on were angled wrong. Sorry for saying the word angle so much, I’m just not good at describing this stuff. I would recommend you watch all of the YouTube videos comparing the newer iPhone models. This phone has night vision to enable Face ID in the dark. Whereas my 2018 iPad Pro cannot read my face in the dark. I don’t know what else to say, except that you should read every review and watch every review you can to decide on which iPhone is best for you. This phone is the cheapest iPhone that came out in 2019 but that doesn’t mean it’s bad. I love this phone very much. It has a really good battery life and standby time. Much better than my 7 which by the way I had the battery for that phone replaced and restored to 100% battery health a week before buying this and that battery sucks in comparison to this one even with the 100% restore. So yeah I’m happy with my phone. Also I use my phone mainly for music and I can listen with my AirPods all day and my phone will be at 40 something percent when the day is almost over. I know my grammar is bad. I just want people to know that this is a good phone

Text: I upgraded my iPhone 8 to an iPhone 11 and could not be happier.

Heading: Great phone with real all day battery
Text: I upgraded to this phone from an iPhone 6s and it is a huge improvement. On the second battery in my 6s the phone would die after a few hours of moderate use. With the 11 after a full day(12+hours) of moderate to heavy use I have yet to put the battery lower than 35%. I much prefer Face ID over Touch ID and it is almost instantaneous. I compared the screen side by side to the Pro and besides the blacks being slightly blacker the resolution difference is not that apparent to me for everyday use. Cameras and photo processing are excellent. If you like the iPhone ecosystem then this is a great phone.

Heading: This phone is a great deal !
Text: You get more bang for your buck with this iPhone than any other model.  It is easy to use and the battery holds a charge for a couple of days.  The new swiping that replaced the home button is actually easier, and I love the face recognition

Heading: Hate it
Text:
Bought this phone after loving my previous 2 iphones, 6s+ and 8s+. Absolutely HATE it. I bought it the day before leaving the country for 3 weeks and missed the return window. Face ID sucks. Screen is "larger" but it feels smaller since my hand is blocking part of it most of the time. Screen was very easily scratched compared to my last 2 iphones they definitely changed something there. Never even needed a protector and a few weeks with this it looks terrible. 

To boot I specifically asked the salesman if I would be able to use the phone overseas since I was flying out the next day and since I was paying for the phone in full he said yes no problem, but Verizon locks ALL devices for 60 days so there's nothing I could do. I was basically without a phone for 3 weeks unless on wifi and still missed the return window. Wish I never bought it.

Heading: Wonderful phone and was easy to set up!
Text: This phone was extremely easy to set up.  I selected the wrong set up option the first time around but was able to easily and quickly reset the phone and set it up the way I wanted to.  The best part of setup?  It automatically downloaded all the apps from my old phone, saving me hours of time!  Love the new cameras!  Love the new colors!  Of course I selected my favorite:  purple!  The only issue I had with the phone resolved itself:  I could not hear calls unless I placed it in speaker mode, a minor-ish issue.  The sound on calls works perfectly now.

Text: I had the iPhone 7 for over 4 years and the phone itself was in great shape but the battery life was awful. I’d have to charge it 3 or 4 times a day. I needed to upgrade. After doing research i decided on the iPhone 11 and i am very pleased. The purple color is beautiful. It’s a bigger phone but it’s not massive. The battery life is excellent so far. I charge it every other day. The camera is great. I’m very happy with this phone.

Heading: Camera takes the best pictures!
Text: This phone is easy to learn how to use, even for a beginner! Its even easy for seniors (as I'm one of them). the price was just right and I thought it was going to be a lot more. I love the color! If anyone is thinking of getting a new cell phone or just up grading this is the phone to get.

Text: This was an upgrade for my son from an iPhone SE. Great features, beautiful Red color, great battery life, and the camera is very good. iOS 13 works seamlessly so far on this device. Great option for anyone that’s wants to upgrade but doesn’t really need all of the perks the pro line offers.

Heading: Phone is good
Text: Verizon rep told me that all of my pictures were on the cloud and would appear when I turned on the new phone. He was wrong and as a result I lost valuable memories that I cannot get back. I should never recommend Best Buy for a place to buy a phone.

Heading: Great upgrade from the 10(x,xr,xs)
Text:
I traded in my Iphone x for the 11. I believe this is worth the money than going to the Iphone 11 pro. 

I you dont need: 
telescope camera lens (3rd lens)
additional antenna
Stainless steel trim
Midnight Green color
1-2 hours more battery life
2 more meters under water
2688 x 1242 resolution instead of 2426 x 1125

Then get the 11. Just saved you $300+ if you get the 11

Text: Easy to use, good camera. large screen for the size of the phone, love the  facial recognition, takes excellent pictures, large amount of storage.

Heading: Love the color and the battery life
Text:
I've always eyed red version iPhones but I never really liked any of them and XR, while looking the color I wanted, was not the specs I wanted. But with this 11, I was finally able to let go of my iPhone X and move on. The display compared to iPhone X is different, and maybe it's inferior to some people, but to me it doesn't seem inferior as I can do everything I normally do on the phone okay. If you need color accurate phone to do photo or video editing, then it's not the phone you need, but then again, if you need to do it that badly you probably have a tablet or laptop for that.

Also, the battery life has been amazing. I sometimes forget to charge my phone overnight and with the 11, that is ok.

If you're looking to try iPhone or upgrade from an older iPhone and want a great value, this is it, especially with deals Best Buy has on this frequently.

Heading: Great battery and camera
Text: Battery life is excellent and camera takes beautiful pictures. I took a picture of the sunset on Pismo Beach Pier and nobody believes I took the picture, they say it looks like a post card.

Heading: Nice phone
Text: Nice phone, camera takes great pics and the battery life is excellent.

Heading: Great Upgrade
Text:
Have been an iPhone user for years. This is the first time I’ve bought the latest and greatest phone after my iPhone 7 battery was dying. 

It has been a terrific upgrade.  Easy to get use to the Face ID as the home button replacement. 

My only complaint is that you have to use the volume and right side button simultaneously to turn the phone on& off. Not sure why Apple made this change from previous phones.

Heading: Great Phone!

Heading: Great phone
Text: I like the easy operation and the camera is great. The picture quality is great. The new updates are also great.

Heading: Waited and waited and waited!
Text: Before I finally made up my mind on the iPhone 11, I still had the iPhone 6s which I got when that was new. I watched all of the iPhones that came out after go by and finally decided to get the 11. Boy am I glad I did! I love everything about the phone. The camera is amazing, the new way to take a screenshot is much better and the the size is just perfect! It only took a few hours to get used to not having a home button. Oh, and the white is just gorgeous!

Heading: Great Phone! Perfect camera!!
